story:
Cirque Us

Training by day and dreaming of circus by night, young emerging circus artists combined their dedication and aspirations to form a company. In 2016, the cast and crew of Cirque Us developed their first full length show, and performed it 20 times across New England and New York. Fast forward two years: Cirque Us is booked for over 40 shows, will travel to more than 20 cities, and will reach about 9,000 audience members in its 2018 summer tour, Starstruck: A Cosmic Circus.

The past two years would not have been successful without the generous donations and assistance the company received from friends, family, and other supporters. To keep the company afloat and to produce the show of our dreams, we continue to ask for support from our communities. We need funding to increase our production value, rent bigger theatres, improve our marketing, and hold true to our mission of keeping tickets affordable. This round of donations will allow us to improve our existing infrastructure to sustain our operations and mission for the long term. We hope to one day be able to support all of the company’s employees, who currently donate their time to this project because they wholeheartedly believe in the importance of our mission.

Our Expenses

While we’re bringing the magic to the show free of charge, there are some things we can’t bring with us. Here is a breakdown of fees we are hoping donations will help us cover!

-Theater Rental – We are renting 16 theaters this summer

-Transportation – It takes two cars and a van and lots of gas to take our show on the road

-Housing – We have to provide housing for 10 artists for 9 weeks

-Equipment  – New Equipment, Mats, Rigging, and Lights  

-Production – Costumes, Props, Make-up, Sets, Speakers, Original Music  

-Marketing – Newspaper Ads, Social Media Ads, Promotional Materials

-Administration – Marketing Department, Administrators, Director Fees

-Legal & Insurance - Just in case.

The Impact

All of us can tell you a story of how the circus changed our lives. Most of our stories start with the first time we saw a circus. Circus teaches the value of teamwork and the importance of self-expression. It brings a group of individuals together around a common goal, teaching people of all ages to step outside of their comfort zone and try something that challenges and inspires them in ways they never thought possible. We hope to inspire our audiences to dream a little bigger through their time with us. If nothing more, we hope to create a place for people to come together and enjoy a show!  

Additionally, we believe in the growth of Circus Arts in the United States. We know first-hand the positive impact that circus can have on children, adolescents and adults and we can only hope that one day our artform will be recognized as its own artistic category. Our country has produced some of the greatest singers, dancers, actors, and visual artists, and perhaps one day “circus artists” will be added to that list. Circus provides participants with both an athletic and artistic outlet to create political, emotional, humorous, or simply entertaining art.

Other Ways You Can Help

Here are some additional ways you can help us share the magic of circus!

1. Make a match! Ask people you know if they’ll match your support for this project, or if they will send the link to their friends and families. Anything you can do to help us spread the word about this project will be a huge help!

2. Share our project! Twitter, Facebook, Instagram - Give us a little social love by sharing our link on your social media. The more people we reach, the more donations we can potentially receive.

3. Come see our show! Nothing is more important in the arts than going out and supporting the work of others! Can’t buy a ticket? Email info@thecirqueus.com to learn more about volunteering at one of our shows this summer.

Thank you so much for supporting Cirque Us and our mission to share the magic of circus!

Sincerely,

Doug Stewart, Alec McGowan, Cam Zweir, Delaney Bayles, Justin Durham, Lindsey Barrows, Ivan Jeryman, Marieke Dailey, Rena Dimes, Sam Gurwitt, Sarah Tiffin, Kerian Mckeon, Hannah Tymosko, and Nina Gershy

 

Perk Descriptions 

Signed Show Poster

Receive a 2018 show poster signed by the cast and crew of Cirque Us!

Tickets to a Show

Get tickets to any self-presented Cirque Us show! 

T-Shirts

Receive the original Cirque Us T-Shirt Design!

Sweatshirts

Receive the original Cirque Us Sweatshirt Design worn only by the cast, crew and our valued donors!

Early Seating

Enter the theatre early to catch the last bit of warm-ups and rehearsals and choose your favorite seats! 

Pie in the Face

Pie the cast member of your choice on stage after the show!

Life Time Supply of Tickets

Receive up to 10 tickets per season to self-presented Cirque Us shows for the rest of time!

PreShow Announcements

Get a personal thank you in the Preshow announcements before every show!

Bring the Circus to you!

We will bring circus artists to your next party or event! Check out our website for additional information! 

Circus Lesson

A circus lesson taught by Doug Stewart! Lessons can be done with other members of the cast depending on availability! 

Dinner with the Cast

Join the cast of Cirque Us for dinner!

story:
BALETT MÉCANIQUE

We are a group of young artist from Portugal, France and Brazil that lives in Portugal and works with goal to create and materialize ideas. 
Ballet Mécanique received partial funding from the Burning Man Arts Grant but we need your help to complete the finance of the project and help us expand this approach to even more projects.

This interactive project aims to seeks a kaleidoscopic perception of inside out space. As the individual makes the structure spin, him self runs too.The fragments of mirror that compose the form create a metamorphose of images that suround it, images that shange acording to the moviment of the dome.
Together, by spining the structure, each person can take their own perception of the space, with a bunch of mutant images that will (re)construct a (new) reality. Here the individual by puting the real in transformation arrives to a non convencional way of seeing, between the objective and subjective world.

This installation is based on the creation of a perceptive kaleidoscopic system of space, for an illusory, abstract, hypnotic and timeless thought about it. Is through a structure made up of mirror fragments and their upward / downward movement, as well as the rotational movement of the structure itself, that the reflections and the light will conceive a challenge to the perception of the image of the "real" by exploiting a space-time labyrinth consciousness for the one who interacts with it. This developed labyrinthine consciousness is the epigraph for the intended surrealist atmosphere, which is based on the cinematography of Man Ray in "Le Ballet Méchanique" (1924) by Fernand Léger.

This relation, exercised by both the mirror-modifying force and the complexity of the movement, summoning the dream-one draws the tenuous line between reality and illusion, the mirror where being and matter, eye and atmosphere are confused.

The refletions preserve the enigma,
time provokes thought,
and movement creates the imaginary.

 

We have a fantastic team for the project: 
Sara Soares, Merlin Kuntz, Nuno Neves, Maria Novo, Ana Maria Pereira, Tomás Marques, Marceau Kuntz, Pedro Pimentel.

 

BUDJET

Your help would make this project possible.

story:
Short Summary

  • Knew Conscious Gallery and Collective is an art gallery and members only event space focused on providing an environment for the arts, music and service communities to gather and network. After seven successful years operating in RiNo, we have recently moved to a bigger location in LoDo.
  • Some unforeseen obstacles have come up with moving to a bigger space. The City of Denver is requiring us to re-zone our building. In order to comply with the new zoning requirements, we must undergo additional construction.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The cost of construction is a bit more than we anticipated. With your contributions, we can speed up the process.
  • To raise that last bit of money, we are offering heavily discounted packages for memberships and shows. Memberships will become active upon our re-opening. As an added perk, all contributors can skip the line for for duration of their membership. If you are an existing member of Knew Conscious, or had a membership in the past, your account will be updated to reflect your contribution. If want to sign up for a first time membership, you will be sent an application that will be reviewed and entered into our database. If for any reason we choose to deny your membership, your contribution will be refunded immediately. We have also reached out to some of our friends to offer limited addition 18x24" prints produced by Threyda, as well as a few original works of art.
  • The funds raised will go towards building bigger bathrooms, fire exits, additional fire sprinklers, improved heating and air conditioning, etc.

The Impact

  • Knew Conscious Gallery has been a premier gallery for visionary art for the better part of a decade. Over past few years we have added an event space to showcase musicians both local and international and blur the lines between visual arts and music.
  • The City of Denver Arts & Venues department and the Creative Spaces Fund have pledged a grant of their own to help with the cost of construction, showing us their belief and appreciation for what we provide for the community. 
  • If we exceed our goal, the additional funds will go directly toward bringing more art to Denver.

Risks & Challenges

  • There is very little risk of this project, only challenges. We do not want to break ground on construction until we have all of the funds in place. Our biggest challenge is raising money as quickly as possible so we can meet out ideal reopening date.
  • Our commitment to our vision has led us to overcome any risk or challenge that had been presented to us. This one is no different.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to contribute to this campaign, there are still ways you can help. Share on all of your social media accounts, tell everyone you know!
  • If you want to contribute more than our highest tiered perk, please contact us. Contributions above our highest tier would be tax-deductible and made payable to the Denver Creative Spaces Fund, which has been an invaluable resource to us during this re-zoning process. For more information on them, please visit http://www.artsandvenuesdenver.com/create-denver/creative-space-resources.

story:
Support Norte Maar’s #makemoreart in our teenage years campaign!

13 years of disruption: art in alternative venues, punk performance in abandoned buildings, poetry shoutouts from the sidewalks.

 

Help us stay untamed! and out of the mainstream!

Support us today.

 

As we race towards our teenage years we need your support to keep us on the edge, at the forefront of new art, poetry and dance in Brooklyn and beyond. Quite simply… help us... help artists... #makemoreart

By supporting Norte Maar you not only support our core programs but also our creative agenda based on ideas of imagination, spontaneity and cross-disciplinary collaboration.

Everyone who supports us knows just how far their gift goes to financially support our volunteer-led organization and our mission to encourage, promote and present new art, new poetry, new performance while bringing attention to emerging artist communities in Brooklyn and beyond.

Now more than ever, we need to think bigger, smarter. And we need to do it more often with a cast of diverse voices that echo the artists and community we represent.

Help us to help others to fly effortlessly, to break out beyond the studio, to stretch boundaries that seek to keep art quiet, inaccessible to some or out of reach for others, to come together to share experience and ideas, to build community.

With your donation to Norte Maar's #makemoreart campaign you may choose a perk that is well worth your money!

Norte Maar is a non-profit 501(c)3 organization founded in 2004 by curator Jason Andrew and choreographer Julia K. Gleich. Donations made to Norte Maar are fully tax-deductible less the estimated value of any goods or services received.

Film Credits:
"Norte Maar's Brooklyn Performance Combine"
director of photography & editing: Steven Speliotis

story:
I’m interested in using yarn as my new painting medium. I’ve been working on a latch hook rug for the past few months. The process of latch hooking requires knotting each strand of yarn one at a time. There are tricks to make the process faster, but even still it’s not fast enough! My current latch hook rug is about 10% finished.

With your help, I’ll purchase a hand tufting machine to make the rug making process exponentially faster! I estimate that I could finish a 3ft x 4ft a rug in a few days to a week rather than months to a year!

What I Need & What You Get

Your generous donations will go towards purchasing the hand tufting machine and materials. The machine will cost around $750 plus shipping. My budget for rug backing, yarn, and threads will be around $300. Altogether, my goal is to raise $1,050.

I would love to raise funds by donations and pre-orders. I will offer a few perks for your donations: rug wall-hangings, rug coasters, pom-pom keychains, and postcard packs of paintings and drawings. Pre-orders and perks will be sent out once enough funds are raised to purchase the machine.

Pre-ordered rugs will come in various sizes:

X-Small: Coaster pack of 4

Small: 17in x 24in (wall-hanging option)

Medium: 3ft x 4ft (wall-hanging option)

Large: 5ft x 8ft

Extra-Large: 8ft x 10ft

Once the rugs are made, an email with photos of the finished rugs will be emailed to all buyers. Rugs will be claimed on a first-come first-served basis. Announcements will be made closer to the date about exact time the email will be sent. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot afford to help monetarily, you can help by spreading the word and sharing this page on facebook, Instagram, email, twitter, etc! I'm also accepting yarn donations for any unused yarn you would like to give away.

Thank you for your support! Excited to get started on this new project!

story:
Summary

We are the Metonymy Collective, a group of artist who work across disciplines to create multimedia performances, installations and community spaces. Our goal is to explore the empty places. We dance with the multiple story lines of history. To accomplish this task we utilize memory as a catalyst for art and community actions.

While we have previously created out art with our owns funds, our current project is expanding more rapidly then we anticipated. It is for this reason that we are starting this campaign to help support Memory Flow/Water of Boston. Boston's drinking water flows over a history of colonization and forced evacuation. In performance the revives layers of memory and systemic violence that are submerged under the Quabbin Reservoir. A labyrinthine structure of plastic membranes, pictures suspended in water, paper cuts and masked performers, will turn the performance space into a memory chamber.  The audience navigate the space, exploring the depths of a drowned history.

Your support will allow us build the last stages of the labyrinth and prepare it to be exhibited in future venues. Our upcoming performance will occur on February 24th during Xfest, which this year will occur in the Dorchester Art Project, Boston. Please check out our website and social media for future updates on the production and the performance.  Thank you so much for your support!

 

The Larger Picture

Memory Flow/Water of Boston is only the beginning of a multifaceted collaboration that explores forced depopulation and environmental destruction in Western Massachusetts, through the lens of land and water rights. It will manifest in a series of art/historical exhibitions, performances, and town hall discussions. The project will primarily focus on the Quabbin reservoir, and the history that lies under its surface. 

The Quabbin area has previously been inhabited by Native American Nations. They were violently displaced by the pioneer towns built in the area. Greater Boston Area’s water needs were the second agent that pushed the area to be depopulated and reshaped through the forces of capital and “public interest.”

Through combination of art and discussion we hope to draw parallels with future environmental and human realities. Awareness regarding the topic of water consumption and water rights are the not isolated to reality of the Quabbin reservoir.  From the Water Protectors in North Dakota to the Pacific Islands on the brink of destruction, water flow has always been a global issue. The different events will thus use the medium of history to weave together a conversation that feeds into current political action. Thank you for being part of this conversation.

 

Other Ways To Be Involved

If money is hard to come by, we completely understand. However, if you are interested in collaborating in any shape and form, we very welcome to working with you. Also if you have extra materials such as draft paper, lights, ladder and pedestals, we would very gratefully borrow them for the duration of the performance. Feel free to reach out and contact us through our website or on social media.

story:
Consum, egoism, promiscuity, superficiality, the desire to own.... These all demons our world are in my paintings. I am a girl from Slovakia and create art by a pseudonym/brand Kriss Keller. I work years with children, and I am crazy into children's artworks. That's why my paintings are so colourful, dynamic and expressive. They look pretty even though the content is not very sweet.

It is my first very personal collection. Until now, I painted mostly customized things. I told myself I deserve after 15 years of painting for others also a collection for me and for people who are letting me free and are brave enough to see the truth.
 

I want to spread these paintings towards people so they can see reality through art.

Crowdfunding money will be used for purchasing online marketing campaigns:

- at my online shop Kriss Keller on Etsy ($1000)
- presentation of the collection on Instagram ($1000)
- buying more equipment for painting ($500)

Every dollar counts.


All paintings: Acrylic on a canvas with a pen writing/drawing on it
Sizes vary: From 50 cm (19.7 inch) till 120 cm (47.2 inch)
Years of creating: 2017 - 2018

You can buy them as digital prints and as originals as well.

 

Check my website for more info www.krisskeller.com

Also for seeing and buying more my artworks here is my Etsy Shop Kriss Keller

And for following on Instagram, KrissKellerAuthor

THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP

story:
• Patches is a 17-year old artist who was born and raised on the south-side of Chicago. His mom would have him model for her photography projects when he was little and it inspired him to be the performer he his today. He would constantly enjoy shaping the space around him. Once he got into theater at 14 he knew it was something he wanted to do for the rest of his life.

  • "NYU is my dream university, this program would raise the chances of being admitted to the college and give college credit. This is my chance to step outside of home, outside of the familiar- my chance to push myself as an artist into a space that, as a person of color, I never thought I would be offered. If I do not reach my goal by the deadline, the funds will go towards my college tuition which will also help." - Patches Blanton

  • Program Link: http://www.nyu.edu/admissions/high-school-progr...

  •  It's essential as a youth artist-activist he continue to push himself to the limit and discover different ways of being present on stage- NYU's program is an intensive curriculum that will equip him with acting skills at a college level and pace.

  • If you help Patches get to NYU, you would be helping a performer reach the school that he thought might not have ever offered him the opportunity of his dreams to learn more about what he is truly passionate about.
  • The goal is to raise $2,000 by March 18 for the deposit and $10,578 by May 14 for the tuition.

  • He is hard worker no matter what it comes to. And is always ready to work with other artists.

  • If he doesn't reach his entire goal, the funds will go towards his college education.

  • He has been in previous shows such as Track 13, Dope, Nerds Sluts Commies and Jocks, and Cold Summer which all critically address young people's realities, and how they live in it.

The deadline is a major obstacle. We know its' a lot of money to raise in a short amount of time but we are willing to reach out to fellow artists and performers for a chance to achieve a dream that is only a step away with enough support.

story:
Marchela Dimitrova is Bulgarian, married to a Bulgarian Orthodox Priest. An artist from an early age, her interest in icons began in 1996. She studied for two years with a master and was then awarded the title of master-iconographer. She works in the traditional Byzantine style and her work appears in a great number of churches and monasteries – mainly orthodox but including Protestant and Catholic – around the world. She uses traditional Byzantine techniques painting in egg tempera and using 24 carat gold leaf.

For 18 years Marchela Dimitrova has painted over 200 icons and wall-paintings. She would like to share her work with more people around the world. A project of creating collection of 120 post cards with 120 sacred icons painted by her was set up this year.

Please see the link: 120 Sacred Icons by Marchela Dimitrova

The project includes 10 sets with 12 icons each.  The sets are:

Set 1. "Icons of Angels" [Includes 12 icons: Icons of Archangel Michael and Archangel Gabriel, Angels, Seraphims, Choir of Angels, Jesus Christ & Virgin Mary with Archangels Michael and Gabriel.]

Please see the link: Set 1 "Icons of Angels"





Set 2. "Icons of Angels" [Includes 12 icons: Icons of Archangel Michael, Archangel Gabriel, Angels, Guardian Angels and Archangels Raphael, Jegudiel, Barachiel, Salathiel and Uriel.]

Please see the link: Set 2 "Icons of Angels"





Set 3. "Icons of Jesus Christ" [Includes 12 icons: Icons of Jesus Christ, Jesus Christ Pantocrator, Jesus Christ Just Judge, Deesis and The Holy Mandylion of Jesus Christ.]

Please see the link: Set 3 "Icons of Jesus Christ"





Set 4. "Icons of British Saints" [Includes 12 icons: Icons of St. Finnian of Clonard, St. Botolph of Iken, St. Brendan the Navigator, St. Columba of Iona, St. Edmund King and Martyr, St. Fursey, St. Cedd, St. Felix and St. Alban.]

Please see the link: Set 4 "Icon of British Saints"




Set 5. "Icons of British Female Saints" [Includes 12 icons: Icons of St. Hilda of Whitby, St. Aethelthryth (Audrey, Etheldreda), St. Bridget of Ireland, St. Winifred, St. Julian of Norwich, St. Mildred of Minster, St. Walburga, St. Morwenna and St. Margaret.]

Please see the link: Set 5 "Icons of British Female Saints"





Set 6. "Icons of British Saints" [Includes 12 icons: Icons of St. Cuthbert, St. Gall, St. Aidan of Lindisfarne, St. Bede, St. Caedmon and the Symbols of the 4 Evangelists: Matthew, Luke, Mark & John.]

Please see the link: Set 6 "Icons British Saints"





Set 7. "Icons of Western & Eastern Saints" [Includes 12 icons: Icons of St. Andrew, St. Aquilina, St. Anthony the Great, St. Benedict of Nursia, St. Cecilia, St. Francis of Assisi, St. Manfred of Riva, St. Mary Magdalene, St. Nicholas, St. Pancras, St. Paul and St. Prophet & King David.]

Please see the link: Set 7 "Icons of Western & Eastern Saints"





Set 8. "Icons of Eastern Saints" [Includes 12 icons: Icons of St. Demetrius of Thessaloniki, St. John the Baptist, St. Alexander of Alexandria, St. Matthew, St. Mary of Egypt, St. Mary Magdalene, St. Nicholas, St. Silouan the Athonite, St. Olga, St. Prophet Elias, St. Theodore Tyron & St. Theodore Stratelates.]

Please see the link: Set 8 "Icons of Eastern Saints"






Set 9. "Festal Icons" [Includes 12 icons: Icons of St. Myrrhbearers, Naming the Animals, Noli Me Tangere, Resurrection of Jesus Christ, Jesus Christ & All Saints, Theotokos Life Giving Spring, St. John the Baptist & St. Andrew, St. Procopius of Ustyug, St. John the Baptist, St. Sophia, Faith, Hope & Love, Virgin Katafigi & St. John the Theologian.]

Please see the link: Set 9 "Festal Icons"




Set 10. "Icons of Mary Mother of God" [Includes 12 icons: Icons of Mary Mother of God Eleusa, Mary Mother of God Odigitria, Virgin Mary and Our Lady of Sorrows.]

Please see the link: Set 10 "Mary Mother of God"


We are planning to print 120 postcards  [ 10 sets x 12 cards ] of size A6 [W: 4.1 x H: 5.8 inches] or  [W: 105 x H: 148 mm] and first edition of 500 [five hundred] copies of each postcard. The postcards will be full colour on front and black on back with UV coating on the front.

The graphic design will be done by Fr. Nedyalko Dimitrov who is helping in this campaign as volunteer. 


What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to raise $3000 USD [three thousand USD]  to cover the printing and shipping costs. The graphic design and all other work will be done by volunteers.  

We would like to share this collection of 120 sacred icons with as many people as possible. And we are most thankful to all people who are helping us. We are not just asking you to contribute. Every level of participation brings its own reward. 

All perks will be delivered even if we do not reach the goal. They will be mailed starting in July. All perks will be mailed internationally.  You can order more than one perk.

Here is a list of amounts and perks:

For $ 5

1 set of 12 postcards chosen by you [from the 10 sets available for choosing] + 1 postcard with special thanks sighed by the icon painter Marchela Dimitrova and mailed internationally.

For $ 10

2 sets of 12 postcards chosen by you [from the 10 sets available for choosing] + 1 postcard with special thanks sighed by the icon painter Marchela Dimitrova and mailed internationally.


For $ 15

3 sets of 12 postcards chosen by you [from the 10 sets available for choosing] + 1 postcard with special thanks sighed by the icon painter Marchela Dimitrova and mailed internationally.


For $ 20

4 sets of 12 postcards chosen by you [from the 10 sets available for choosing] + 1 postcard with special thanks sighed by the icon painter Marchela Dimitrova and mailed internationally.


For $ 25

5 sets of 12 postcards chosen by you [from the 10 sets available for choosing] + 1 postcard with special thanks sighed by the icon painter Marchela Dimitrova and mailed internationally.


For $ 30

6 sets of 12 postcards chosen by you [from the 10 sets available for choosing] + 1 postcard with special thanks sighed by the icon painter Marchela Dimitrova and mailed internationally.


For $ 35

7 sets of 12 postcards chosen by you [from the 10 sets available for choosing] + 1 postcard with special thanks sighed by the icon painter Marchela Dimitrova and mailed internationally.


For $ 40

8 sets of 12 postcards chosen by you [from the 10 sets available for choosing] + 1 postcard with special thanks sighed by the icon painter Marchela Dimitrova and mailed internationally.


For $ 45

9 sets of 12 postcards chosen by you [from the 10 sets available for choosing] + 1 postcard with special thanks sighed by the icon painter Marchela Dimitrova and mailed internationally.


For $ 50

10 sets of 12 postcards [the full collection of 10 sets] + 1 postcard with special thanks sighed by the icon painter Marchela Dimitrova and mailed internationally.


If we do not reach the entire goal we will diminish number of the copies of the first edition but all perks will be delivered even if we do not reach the goal.

The Impact

We would like to share our passion about the sacred icons with as many people as possible.

Risks & Challenges

Some photos of the icons are not of the best quality. They have been taken in the period of 18 years and some of them have reflections [because of the golden background of the icons], small number of them have low resolution or are dark. We will try to fix it with the help of experienced graphic designer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Finally, please help us to spread the word. If you have enjoyed reading this, if the project excites you, then please help spread the word. Please pass on this announcement any way you can—Facebook, Twitter, email lists, blogs, simple one-on-one communications… 

Thank You For Your Help!

story:
The Floasis has successfully run a (legal!) fire arts venue and practice space in Bushwick for the last seven years.  We've hosted showcases, markets, classes and community practice events, as well as an FDNY accepted safety course for fire artists wishing to become licensed.  We've been a community hub for hobbyists and professionals alike.

We’ve worked with many independent fire artists and different venues to try to make fire shows happen, but many venues find the costs and bureaucracy of the permits prohibitive.  We can fix this!  

We're forming a non profit called Combustion Inc. to sponsor permits for small shows and help with the bureaucracy and equipment that prevents fire artists from bringing you their art.

Who will this benefit?  Everyone!

Performers will have more job opportunities to do legal shows, and more of an opportunity to produce their own shows as well.

Venues will gain access to fantastic programming that may have been unavailable to them before. 

Audiences will get better shows at many of your favorite spots, including free public shows like Combustion!NYC in the city parks!

The money we raise will cover startup costs for Combustion Inc including formation, legal and professional fees, and grant writers to get us up and running sustainably.

story:
Help make The Harlow accessible

The Harlow’s new home at 100 Water Street, just down the street from our old location is the perfect building for an art-space. It has two floors and multiple rooms, doubling our exhibition capacity, we now have dedicated workshop space, a new craft shop and accessible bathrooms on each floor.  It’s much larger than our original home, and this has allowed us to expand programming to better serve the central Maine community. Our main gallery space is up a flight of stairs so it is essential that we install a wheelchair in the lobby to allow people with mobility challenges to enjoy our art exhibitions and events. We want to be able to welcome everyone in the community into our new space to enjoy the arts, including the 16% of Mainers who have some type of disability. We all know that the population of the state Maine is one of the oldest in the nation, and more and more of us are chosing to age in place. Our little city of Hallowell alone has multiple elderly housing facilities.

 

Phase 1: Give us a Lift!

Since early this year we have been working with consultants to determine the best, safest and most effective solutions to make the main gallery space fully accessible. We’ll be installing a professional grade wheelchair lift in the front lobby by mid 2019 or even sooner, if fundraising goes well! We’ll select one of three Maine-based ADA approved companies who have provided us with advice, recommendations and quotes to fine tune their design and specifications and complete the work as soon as we reach our fundraising goals. 

There is a good chance that the new sidewalks being installed this summer by MaineDOT as part of the Water Street reconstruction will provide us with an accessible front entrance, and one of the parking spaces in front of our building will be designated handicapped parking with a cut curb for sidewalk access. The timing is perfect!

 

Phase 2: lower level access

If we surpass our goal, funding will go to “Phase 2” of our accessibility project, which is to either install a stair chair or ramp to provide access to the lower level exhibition and workshop space via the front or side entrance.

 

A little history

The Harlow Gallery is owned and operated by the Kennebec Valley Art Association (KVAA), a 501(c)3 membership-based nonprofit founded in 1958. The KVAA opened the Harlow Gallery in downtown historic Hallowell in 1963, and thousands of Maine artists have shown their work at The Harlow over the intervening decades.

The Harlow embodies central Maine’s grassroots arts community with its diversity of art forms, welcoming atmosphere and spirit of experimentation and creativity. We are a vitally important cultural touchstone not just for Augusta, Hallowell, Gardiner, but for all the surrounding rural communities. While we primarily serve central Maine as an arts and cultural center, we are a known destination for artists and art lovers from statewide and beyond, attracting over 7,000 visitors annually resulting in direct economic benefits to the region. The Harlow Gallery was designated “Best Gallery in Maine 2015” by readers of Down East Magazine by popular vote.

Our mission is to connect and celebrate art, artists and community. We believe the arts are integral to a well-rounded society and so offer exhibitions, lectures, poetry readings, workshops, performances and more. Artists and community groups use the Harlow for meetings and cultural events and we offer opportunities for artist networking and professional development. Our unique, membership-based model supports artists at all levels: students, emerging artists, artists with disabilities, hobbyists and professionals. No portfolio review is required and every member is eligible to participate in two annual members’ shows resulting in wonderfully diverse, inclusive, salon style exhibitions. For more information about current and upcoming exhibitions and programs please visit us online at www.harlowgallery.org.

 

Exclusive Harlow perks to thank you

We are excited to offer incentives to the donors of our campaign. Check out the perks in the right-hand column, which include unique Harlow Handmade items, gift certificates and ongoing public recognition for major donors.

 

Perk FAQs

 

When will I receive my perk?

You will receive your gift shortly after the campaign ends.

 

Is shipping included in the perk prices?

Yes! Shipping is included in the perk prices if needed.

 

I’m local. Can I pick up my gift in person?

Absolutely! Give us a call at 207-622-3813, or email us at and let us know when you’ll be coming in. Gallery hours are Wednesday - Saturday 12-6pm and Sunday 12-4pm.

 

Other ways to give The Harlow a lift

If you can't contribute, that's okay. There are a couple of other easy ways to help:

 

Share our campaign: Please invite friends who would be interested to contribute via e-mail and social media.

 

Support The Harlow online: Sign up for our e-mail list and follow us on Instagram and Facebook.

 

Visit The Harlow: Come see an exhibition, shop The Harlow's new Craft Shop or sign up for a class. Bring a friend or two!

 

Become a member: Join The Harlow as an artist or community member and get involved!

 

Campaign cover photo credit:  Art pictured over the stairs shown during PLAY in March 2018 by Meghan Nathanson.

We’ll select one of three Maine-based ADA approved companies who have provided us with advice, recommendations and quotes to fine tune their design and specifications and complete the work as soon as we reach our fundraising goals. 
There is a good chance that the new sidewalks being installed this summer by MaineDOT as part of the Water Street reconstruction will provide us with an accessible front entrance, and one of the parking spaces in front of our building will be designated handicapped parking with a cut curb for sidewalk access. The timing is perfect!
 
Phase 2: lower level access
If we surpass our goal, funding will go to “Phase 2” of our accessibility project, which is to either install a stair chair or ramp to provide access to the lower level exhibition and workshop space via the front or side entrance.
 
A little history
The Harlow Gallery is owned and operated by the Kennebec Valley Art Association (KVAA), a 501(c)3 membership-based nonprofit founded in 1958. The KVAA opened the Harlow Gallery in downtown historic Hallowell in 1963, and thousands of Maine artists have shown their work at The Harlow over the intervening decades.
The Harlow embodies central Maine’s grassroots arts community with its diversity of art forms, welcoming atmosphere and spirit of experimentation and creativity. We are a vitally important cultural touchstone not just for Augusta, Hallowell, Gardiner, but for all the surrounding rural communities. While we primarily serve central Maine as an arts and cultural center, we are a known destination for artists and art lovers from statewide and beyond, attracting over 7,000 visitors annually resulting in direct economic benefits to the region. The Harlow Gallery was designated “Best Gallery in Maine 2015” by readers of Down East Magazine by popular vote.
Our mission is to connect and celebrate art, artists and community. We believe the arts are integral to a well-rounded society and so offer exhibitions, lectures, poetry readings, workshops, performances and more. Artists and community groups use the Harlow for meetings and cultural events and we offer opportunities for artist networking and professional development. Our unique, membership-based model supports artists at all levels: students, emerging artists, artists with disabilities, hobbyists and professionals. No portfolio review is required and every member is eligible to participate in two annual members’ shows resulting in wonderfully diverse, inclusive, salon style exhibitions. For more information about current and upcoming exhibitions and programs please visit us online at www.harlowgallery.org.
 
Exclusive Harlow perks to thank you
We are excited to offer incentives to the donors of our campaign. Check out the perks in the right-hand column, which include unique Harlow Handmade items, gift certificates and ongoing public recognition for major donors.
 
Perk FAQs
 
When will I receive my perk?
You will receive your gift shortly after the campaign ends.
 
Is shipping included in the perk prices?
Yes! Shipping is included in the perk prices if needed.
 
I’m local. Can I pick up my gift in person?
Absolutely! Give us a call at 207-622-3813, or email us at and let us know when you’ll be coming in. Gallery hours are Wednesday - Saturday 12-6pm and Sunday 12-4pm.
 
Other ways to give The Harlow a lift
If you can't contribute, that's okay. There are a couple of other easy ways to help:
 
Share our campaign: Please invite friends who would be interested to contribute via e-mail and social media.
 
Support The Harlow online: Sign up for our e-mail list and follow us on Instagram and Facebook.
 
Visit The Harlow: Come see an exhibition, shop The Harlow's new Craft Shop or sign up for a class. Bring a friend or two!
 
Become a member: Join The Harlow as an artist or community member and get involved!
 
Campaign cover photo credit:  Art pictured over the stairs shown during PLAY in March 2018 by Meghan Nathanson.

story:
***Mother's Day Special***

Have a handmade lily, rose, or copper ring made for the mother in your life. For the ring, choose Amethyst (Limited number available!) or Rose Quartz. Purchase a $50 gift certificate and you will receive a Thank You email with the gift certificate and questions about the gift you would like to have made just for you. It's that easy! *See more photos on Instagram @HTV_Jewelry

 

Help welcome Pam into Curve studios by getting your gift certificates toward copper jewelry and art that can be used in-person or on-line.

If you are planning a trip to Asheville, or know someone who is, the River Arts District is a popular destination for locals and travelers, alike. Include Curve Studios in your trip and have your discount ready to use on some amazing items from HTV Jewelry's shop!

 

See her work here:

www.facebook.com/hildathevanjewelry

IG: @htv_jewelry

 

A bit about Pam and her jewelry below:

 

Hi! I'm Pam. I am a former government worker who left the world of consistency and comfort to explore the world and take a chance on myself. I started creating jewelry two years ago and have expanded into raw materials and recycling of old pieces I find. I work with copper mainly, because I love the vibrant color and flexibility of the metal.

I create very small intricate items like roses and lilies, to larger items like pendant lights. I welcome the challenges that my clients give me and enjoy every time I have a new idea. I look forward to being a long-standing member of Curve Studios.

HTV Jewelry has been run out of:

A bedroom in Casper, Wyoming
Cassandra's living room
Patrick's extra bedroom
Anil's extra bedroom
A 1988 Ford E-250 named Hilda (Who took me to the Eclipse Festival in Casper, Wyoming as an artist and Sound Healer)


and now, takes up about half of Pam and Ryan's apartment.

While it has been an amazing journey, the time has come to branch out.
The Curve Studios in the River Arts District of Asheville, NC has an opening for a jewelry maker.
I toured the space, met Angelique (FlyCoopStudios.com) and Cassie (CassieEryallsCeramics.com) and I LOVE THEM! I think they like me.

Which is amazing, y'all!

I've been looking for a space to produce my new jewelry ideas and work without worry of noise or making a mess. I can do it all here.

All I need is some help.

 

The space will be the perfect spot to bring HTV Jewelry into full production mode. Once we get there, rent for the space will be a breeze. Until then, I'm gonna need your support.

By donating to my cause, you receive the amount you donate, plus a little extra, toward a beautiful custom piece of your choosing, made by yours truly.

Everything is made by hand from pure copper sheet metal or wire. No pre-fab stuff here.

Prices are going to go up once I get settled in the shop, so you'll want to make your order soon!

Another option, would be to purchase any of the wonderful items still up on my etsy page:

www.hildathevanjewelry.etsy.com

 

Funds go toward:

RENT. Rent for this space is ~$450/month with a one month deposit. $900

Display cases and tables. While I shall try to find fun and funky pieces at the resale shops around town, displays aren't cheap and I will need 4-5 pieces. ~$450

Display for statement pieces like earrings and necklaces. ~$300

Raw copper, Raw Silver components, sheet metal, precious stones, new pliers (mine are currently so overused that they are offset and do not hold items properly). $250

Your name will also go onto my customer register and you will receive a special discount with any jewelry you purchase.

 

YOU ARE HELPING A LOCAL BUSINESS GROW!

and helping a friend live their dream.

 

It has been wonderful seeing you all as I have traveled, and your support and well wishes have meant the world to me. Thank you for raising me up to this next step.

story:
فكرة العمل : يجسد العمل حياة اللاجئين تحت الماء ، حيث ان اللاجئين الذين لقوا مصرعهم في البحر خلال محاولة اللجوء لم يموتوا ، او انهم ماتوا من وجهة نظر قوانين اليابسة ، غير انهم انتقلوا بإرادتهم الى عالم اخر الموجود في مكان ما ! 
هناك في البحر حيث الحرية والامان ، هناك تعمل ، وتأكل ، وتحب وتنام ! بدون مكياج إنساني وديموقراطي  !

WHY:​

The issue of the refugees has become a deal-breaker for the countries of the world, from west to east, to such an extent that we have treated them as goods. When our markets have had enough of them, we yelled with one voice (we had enough!) They are the ones whom we have kept love and safety from. They are the seekers of freedom, hope and dignity. They found nothing other than the wide sea to be a way out for them. Therefore, they settled therein after the land, from west to east, got narrowed for them.

  :لماذا 

قد امست قضية اللاجئين صفقة  خاسرة لدول العالم غربها وشرقها ، حتى أمسينا نعاملهم كسلع ، متى استكفت اسواقنا منهم صحنا بصوت واحد    ..  برزق الله عمي  
هؤلاء الذين منعنا عنهم الحب والامان الباحثين عن الحرية والامل والكرامة لم يجدوا غير البحر الواسع منفذهم فاستوطنوا به ، بعد ان ضاقت بهم اليابسة مشرقها ومغربها 

HOW :

The artwork portraits the life of refugees underwater by putting together elements of life similar to those we have on land. They live there and we glance at them. 
The funding is divided into three main components: 
1- operations: recruitment of professionals for the construction of the modules, etc.
40% of the budget. 
2- production: the actual building of modules and Decoration under the water.
25% of the budget.
3- visual and audio documentation.35% of the budget.

كيف : تجسيد مشهدية الحياة الآدمية تحت الماء ، هم هناك .. نحن سوف نلقي نظرة عليهم فقط 

MY artistic focus is primarily shedding light on humanitarian events around the globe. It's an attempt to document, in an unorthodox fashion, events that the world deems unworthy of remembering. My aim is to expand the awareness and to convey, through art, an humanitarian message; if the world has forgotten these events, then I will remind them.

ان تخصصي الفني يتمحور حول تسليط الضوء على احداث إنسانية في العالم ، عملية توثيق بطريقة غير تقليدية لأحداث يكاد العالم ينساها 
 .الهدف من مشاريعي هو نشر الوعي وايصال رسالة إنسانية بطريقة فنية 
. اذا كان العالم قد نسي فأنا سوف اذكره

story:
Le spectacle

Les personnages

Prêtes à affronter n'importe quel malheur, n'importe quelle joie bouleversante, Babiole et Berlingot sont des êtres appartenant au présent déchaîné; des êtres sauvages. Babiole, enfant frétillante, éthérée et disjonctée, a de nombreuses manies. Son imaginaire est saturé d'oiseaux. Clowne blanche, Berlingot est l'amie imaginaire de Babiole. Mais elle se rebelle contre l'étroitesse de ce rôle. Babiole patauge dans la peur et laisse ratatiner son désir; Berlingot se croit au-dessus de tout. Le duo s'inspire des enfants punks et majestueux présents dans l’œuvre de Réjean Ducharme : ils habitent l'instant comme un gouffre et un absolu.

Ce que ça raconte

Les deux clownes habitent La Caboche comme une zone à défendre. Routine matinale en compagnie des oiseaux, rituel musical au piano et tours athlétiques de bolo rythment leur vie sobre et fantasque. Pourtant, comme l'écrit Boris Vian, «la vie est amère quand il n'y a pas de sucre au fond». Bien vite, Babiole étouffe. Une crise de panique viscérale lui rappelle que pour trouver la mer, il faut d'abord quitter son terrier. Obsédées par une question («Où es-tu, matière?»), les enfants-clownes vont alors s'aventurer vers le monde pour goûter un ré-enchantement.
 

En coulisses : comment ça se bâtit

  • C'est une écriture poétique qui a propulsé le projet. La trame narrative, minimale, prend ancrage dans cinq poèmes-piliers.
  • Ce spectacle n'a rien à voir avec une suite de numéros. Notre pratique du clown relève du théâtre physique et se tient loin de l'univers circassien.
  • À la manière de Jacques Lecoq, on cherche à « retourner à la source des mots, à ce silence du dessous ». Où es-tu, matière ? exclut donc la parole directe : parce que le corps a énormément à dire, on se trouve libérées des mots.

  • Provoquer le rire, là n'est pas la mission que l'on se donne. On veut conjuguer esprit comique, esprit lunatique et action poétique.

    Durée : 75 minutes
    Public : adulte (à partir de 10 ans)

     

La prévente - ce que TU y gagnes

Voici comment fonctionne la prévente :

  • En achetant ici un billet ouvert, tu pourras assister à une représentation d'Où es-tu, matière?  lors de la tournée prévue pour l'été 2019. Tu pourras choisir plus tard la date et la ville de la représentation à laquelle tu souhaites assister.
  • Tu peux aussi obtenir la magnifique affiche du spectacle, parfaite pour décorer ton salon. Une œuvre visuelle signée Audrey Beaulé. Format 11X17, papier glacé.

  • Finalement, tu peux acheter des cartes postales inédites, et les envoyer à toute ta famille, les offrir en cadeau à tes collègues, amies, voisins. On te propose 3 modèles.

Que ce soit par l'achat d'un billet, d'une affiche ou d'une offre de commandite (qui sait?),
tu soutiens une production indépendante et culottée, 100% réalisée par des artistes femmes.
 

Objectif financier

Avec cette campagne, on veut se donner les moyens de couvrir une bonne partie des frais liés à la production.
 

Nos besoins

L'argent amassé sera utilisé avec parcimonie afin de couvrir nos dépenses principales. C'est important pour nous d'arriver à quelque chose de viable financièrement, qui nous permette d'y mettre toutes nos tripes.

PALIER 1  ___ 2800 à 3500 $
Nous pourrons couvrir les frais liés à :
- la location d'une salle de répétition
- la promotion et la diffusion
- la rémunération de nos complices artistiques

PALIER 2 ___ 3500 à 4500 $
Nous (Julie et Annab) pourrons toucher à une rémunération symbolique.

PALIER 3 ___ 4500 à 5000 $
Nous aurions accès à une résidence de création à l'hiver 2019, au cours de laquelle nous pourrions approfondir chaque parcelle du spectacle, intensifier la recherche et le temps de travail.

PALIER 4 ___ 5000 à 6000 $ et plus encore
Nous pourrons toucher à des cachets plus significatifs et accorder un temps de qualité à la création. Plus de rigueur, plus de finesse encore
 

L'histoire de la compagnie Brimbalante

B R I M B A L A N T E (Populaire) Se dit de quelque chose d’instable qui se balance, qui s’agite.

La compagnie Brimbalante (Obnl) est née de la rencontre de deux clownes folâtres : Julie Chazal et Annab Aubin-Thuot. C'est littéralement à travers le jeu qu'elles se sont connues et enflammées. L'enthousiasme a fait boule de neige, allant jusqu'à matérialiser leur souhait de fonder une compagnie de création à l'automne 2018. Bien que le clown soit une sorte de langue maternelle pour les Brimbalantes, leurs productions se rattachent aux joies de l'interdisciplinarité.

Où es-tu, matière ? est leur première production officielle et de longue haleine.
.

Contribuer autrement

Si vous ne pouvez pas acheter de billet ou autre marchandise, n'hésitez surtout pas à :

  • Partager cette prévente à vos proches, à vos ami-e-s et à vos collègues. Parlez-en de vive voix, envoyez-leur le lien vers notre page, faites que ça devienne viral :-)
  • Il y a des boutons conçus exprès pour partager sur les réseaux sociaux. En haut (à droite de l'image principale), clique sur ''F'' pour partager sur ton facebook, ou sur ''Link'' pour copier le lien url.
     

Pour aller plus loin encore - Devenir partenaires

Si vous avez une entreprise, faites partie d'un collectif, d'un organisme ou d'un centre d'artistes, vous pourriez devenir partenaires du spectacle. Ainsi, votre nom et logo se retrouveraient sur notre matériel promotionnel, afin de solidifier cette complicité naissante et de vous donner de la visibilité. Plusieurs formules sont à concevoir... N'hésitez pas à nous écrire pour qu'on les élabore sur mesure, ensemble, dans l'intérêt de chaque partie.

 

En apprendre davantage sur nous et nos convictions

Nos biographies

Annab est constituée d’une avidité de chercheuse d’or et elle témoigne d’une sensibilité outrageuse pour la fiction. Née à Sutton, elle a vécu à Montpellier (France), à La Paz (Bolivie) et à Val-David (Laurentides). Elle enseigne l'art clownesque à la Caserne 18-30 et au Studio 303 (Montréal). En janvier 2018, elle dépose un mémoire de maîtrise sur la jouissance dans la création (études littéraires, UQÀM). Animatrice en littérature jeunesse pour Livres dans la rue (Bibliothèques de Montréal), elle est aussi pianiste, poète et aime chanter aux alouettes.

Julie Chazal est née dans une famille de musicien-ne-s et c’est au Conservatoire de Saint-Étienne qu’elle fait ses premières armes comme violoncelliste (1995). Depuis, elle réinvente des manières de sentir sa propre musicalité, se faufilant entre les étiquettes de multi-instrumentiste et de monteure son. Elle travaille dans un café montréalais où elle pratique le service à la clientèle comme un art subtil; elle y voit un espace de performance propice à développer ses habiletés physiques et psychiques. En 2017, elle découvert l’art clownesque à l'École de Clown et Comédie Francine Côté.

Nos convictions artistiques

  • Notre volonté artistique est profondément joueuse. Dans un esprit enfantin et fragile, nous aspirons surtout à désarmer.
  • Nous nous prenons à rêver d'instants inouïs et déraisonnables. La récolte, rappelons-nous, se fera toujours dans le jeu.
  • Nous étudions comment faire vivre la poésie en dehors de l'espace traditionnel du livre. Comme l'essayiste Véronique Côté l'écrit : « Je parle de poésie : je ne parle pas de poème. Je parle de la poésie en marche » (2015). À nos yeux, l'espace scénique rend possible une jouissance imprévisible qui transmette le goût de vivre.
  • D’un point de vue musical, nous sommes à la recherche de nouvelles matières sonores afin de déjouer les instruments. À l'encontre d'une perspective harmonique et mélodique, nous veillons surtout à produire quelque chose de senti, d’expérientiel, voire une explosion.

Ce spectacle n'a rien à voir avec une suite de numéros. Notre pratique du clown relève du théâtre physique et se tient loin de l'univers circassien.
À la manière de Jacques Lecoq, on cherche à « retourner à la source des mots, à ce silence du dessous ». Où es-tu, matière ? exclut donc la parole directe : parce que le corps a énormément à dire, on se trouve libérées des mots.
Provoquer le rire, là n'est pas la mission que l'on se donne. On veut conjuguer esprit comique, esprit lunatique et action poétique.Durée : 75 minutesPublic : adulte (à partir de 10 ans) 

La prévente - ce que TU y gagnes
Voici comment fonctionne la prévente :

En achetant ici un billet ouvert, tu pourras assister à une représentation d'Où es-tu, matière?  lors de la tournée prévue pour l'été 2019. Tu pourras choisir plus tard la date et la ville de la représentation à laquelle tu souhaites assister.
Tu peux aussi obtenir la magnifique affiche du spectacle, parfaite pour décorer ton salon. Une œuvre visuelle signée Audrey Beaulé. Format 11X17, papier glacé.
Finalement, tu peux acheter des cartes postales inédites, et les envoyer à toute ta famille, les offrir en cadeau à tes collègues, amies, voisins. On te propose 3 modèles.

Que ce soit par l'achat d'un billet, d'une affiche ou d'une offre de commandite (qui sait?),tu soutiens une production indépendante et culottée, 100% réalisée par des artistes femmes. 
Objectif financier
Avec cette campagne, on veut se donner les moyens de couvrir une bonne partie des frais liés à la production. 

Nos besoins
L'argent amassé sera utilisé avec parcimonie afin de couvrir nos dépenses principales. C'est important pour nous d'arriver à quelque chose de viable financièrement, qui nous permette d'y mettre toutes nos tripes.PALIER 1  ___ 2800 à 3500 $Nous pourrons couvrir les frais liés à :- la location d'une salle de répétition- la promotion et la diffusion- la rémunération de nos complices artistiquesPALIER 2 ___ 3500 à 4500 $Nous (Julie et Annab) pourrons toucher à une rémunération symbolique.PALIER 3 ___ 4500 à 5000 $Nous aurions accès à une résidence de création à l'hiver 2019, au cours de laquelle nous pourrions approfondir chaque parcelle du spectacle, intensifier la recherche et le temps de travail.PALIER 4 ___ 5000 à 6000 $ et plus encoreNous pourrons toucher à des cachets plus significatifs et accorder un temps de qualité à la création. Plus de rigueur, plus de finesse encore 
L'histoire de la compagnie Brimbalante
B R I M B A L A N T E (Populaire) Se dit de quelque chose d’instable qui se balance, qui s’agite.La compagnie Brimbalante (Obnl) est née de la rencontre de deux clownes folâtres : Julie Chazal et Annab Aubin-Thuot. C'est littéralement à travers le jeu qu'elles se sont connues et enflammées. L'enthousiasme a fait boule de neige, allant jusqu'à matérialiser leur souhait de fonder une compagnie de création à l'automne 2018. Bien que le clown soit une sorte de langue maternelle pour les Brimbalantes, leurs productions se rattachent aux joies de l'interdisciplinarité.Où es-tu, matière ? est leur première production officielle et de longue haleine..

Contribuer autrement
Si vous ne pouvez pas acheter de billet ou autre marchandise, n'hésitez surtout pas à :

Partager cette prévente à vos proches, à vos ami-e-s et à vos collègues. Parlez-en de vive voix, envoyez-leur le lien vers notre page, faites que ça devienne viral :-)
Il y a des boutons conçus exprès pour partager sur les réseaux sociaux. En haut (à droite de l'image principale), clique sur ''F'' pour partager sur ton facebook, ou sur ''Link'' pour copier le lien url. 


Pour aller plus loin encore - Devenir partenaires
Si vous avez une entreprise, faites partie d'un collectif, d'un organisme ou d'un centre d'artistes, vous pourriez devenir partenaires du spectacle. Ainsi, votre nom et logo se retrouveraient sur notre matériel promotionnel, afin de solidifier cette complicité naissante et de vous donner de la visibilité. Plusieurs formules sont à concevoir... N'hésitez pas à nous écrire pour qu'on les élabore sur mesure, ensemble, dans l'intérêt de chaque partie.
 En apprendre davantage sur nous et nos convictionsNos biographiesAnnab est constituée d’une avidité de chercheuse d’or et elle témoigne d’une sensibilité outrageuse pour la fiction. Née à Sutton, elle a vécu à Montpellier (France), à La Paz (Bolivie) et à Val-David (Laurentides). Elle enseigne l'art clownesque à la Caserne 18-30 et au Studio 303 (Montréal). En janvier 2018, elle dépose un mémoire de maîtrise sur la jouissance dans la création (études littéraires, UQÀM). Animatrice en littérature jeunesse pour Livres dans la rue (Bibliothèques de Montréal), elle est aussi pianiste, poète et aime chanter aux alouettes.Julie Chazal est née dans une famille de musicien-ne-s et c’est au Conservatoire de Saint-Étienne qu’elle fait ses premières armes comme violoncelliste (1995). Depuis, elle réinvente des manières de sentir sa propre musicalité, se faufilant entre les étiquettes de multi-instrumentiste et de monteure son. Elle travaille dans un café montréalais où elle pratique le service à la clientèle comme un art subtil; elle y voit un espace de performance propice à développer ses habiletés physiques et psychiques. En 2017, elle découvert l’art clownesque à l'École de Clown et Comédie Francine Côté.Nos convictions artistiques
Notre volonté artistique est profondément joueuse. Dans un esprit enfantin et fragile, nous aspirons surtout à désarmer.
Nous nous prenons à rêver d'instants inouïs et déraisonnables. La récolte, rappelons-nous, se fera toujours dans le jeu.
Nous étudions comment faire vivre la poésie en dehors de l'espace traditionnel du livre. Comme l'essayiste Véronique Côté l'écrit : « Je parle de poésie : je ne parle pas de poème. Je parle de la poésie en marche » (2015). À nos yeux, l'espace scénique rend possible une jouissance imprévisible qui transmette le goût de vivre.
D’un point de vue musical, nous sommes à la recherche de nouvelles matières sonores afin de déjouer les instruments. À l'encontre d'une perspective harmonique et mélodique, nous veillons surtout à produire quelque chose de senti, d’expérientiel, voire une explosion.

story:
Short Summary

The Zen Haus Artist Collective was founded in 2014 as a residence and collective for LGBT and ally artists in Albany, NY.  The goal is a large scale artist colony for 20 full time members in Green Mountain Forest region of Vermont.
In December 2014, we fully incorporated as a nonprofit organisation in the State of New York.  The immediate goal is to get full 501(c)3 charity status by the IRS. 

What We Need 

Like every good bureaucrat situation, everything takes time, money, and complication.  One of these complications may stand in the way of us getting the 501(c)3 status that we need to thrive as an organisation. This is why there are lawyers.  
In mid-February 2015, we have an appointment with the law offices of Perlman & Perlman, a firm who specializes in working with nonprofits.  The meeting is to confirm that our paperwork is on the right track and to point out what needs to be done on our end to make sure that we are eligible for 501(c)3 status. (The status situation  is more complicated than most people care about, if you have questions, the board and I will be happy to answer them.)   

The Impact

By donating to our fund, you will be helping our young organisation pay the consultation fee for the meeting, pay for transportation cost for our treasurer Jessica DeWeese to join me in New York City at the meeting, and cover some of the out of pocket costs for application fees to the State of New York that have already been incurred.

Risks & Challenges

This proposition does not come without risks.  The first and foremost is that there is no guarantee that we are going make our other fundraising goals.  This campaign represents the first round of fundraising for our organisation.  There is no guarantee that Zen Haus is going to have the funds that we need to for our expansion plans, even if we have 501(c)3 status.  IRS approval is not a magic pill that makes an organisation flourish.  We are very aware of this fact and as a potential donor to a new non profit organization, you should too.

Another risk is that this plan of having an artist residence and collective is not a guaranteed 501(c)3  eligible idea.  This is why we are meeting with the lawyer.  But we all know the tale of "Humpty Dumpty".  All the lawyers and accountants in the world may not save our organisation from a tax exemption status reserved for private clubs or worse, not eligible for any form of charity status.

Other Ways You Can Help

You are looking at this call for help and are saying to yourself, "I want to fund this all at once", please go to our Facebook page at https://www.facebook.com/ZenHausCollective and send us a message and someone will get back to you as soon as possible.  We have ideas on how you can help in addition to this campaign here.  

As not so well off artists ourselves, we know that from time to time, some of you seeing this cannot afford to help within the timeframe of this campaign; but guess what you can.  If you unable to donate, please send this campaign page to your friends or post it on your social media. Maybe you have friends that can help. We will be forever grateful if you do.

story:
Summary

Ignite Theatre; Igniting Thought, Feeling and Compassion, exploring the social issues of today by connecting community and performance art.

Ignite Theatre are a not-for-profit community focussed theatre company, that aim to produce shows that look at contemporary issues utilising both published and original work that provide scope for new playwrights to showcase their work. By using a mixture of traditional and modern theatre conventions, Ignite aim to take audience members on a journey of self-discovery that will encourage them to question social issues in today’s society. Ignite also aim to use the medium of drama to work with community groups / vulnerable people such as children in care, dementia suffers or the homeless.

We are setting this campaign up to help create a community arts resource in the form of a studio style theatre and art centre. This centre will also have a cafe area which will be used to hold creative memory workshops for people with Alzheimers or Dementia.


What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise £7,000. This money will help us to refurbish a disused commercial building in the city of Gloucester. 

With the funds we aim to:

  • Refurbish the kitchen and bar to bring it up to health and safety standards in order to open a cafe. This cafe will be used by people visiting the building and for creative memory workshops to support elderly people with dementia.
  • Re-decorate the main hall and entrance areas to create a warm and inviting reception and performance area.
  • Install seating and lights to be used during performances / productions
  • Collect tables, chairs, pictures and vintage style items to use in the cafe that will also act as a tool for reminiscence
If we do not reach our target, any money raised will help go towards achieving our vision of creating a community arts hub in the centre of Gloucester.

The Impact

Once opened and works completed, the centre will act as a performance and rehearsal space for local theatre productions, dance classes, youth theatre school and art gallery for local artists to showcase their work. It will also provide rehearsal and meeting space.

The most important aspect will be using the centre to use the creative arts to act as an outreach tool to work with vulnerable community groups, such as children in looked after care, homeless and the elderly. We want this to be a safe, enjoyable and creative environment. 

Risks & Challenges

Ignite recognises that the current economic climate provides a difficult environment for any new venture, however government statistics state that the UK’s creative industries are outperforming all other UK industry sectors, bringing £71.4 billion per year to the UK economy. Ignite aim to utilise this by producing unique, professional work and creating lasting connections within the surrounding community. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to our target, you can help in other ways by

  • Sharing our campaign with your friends and family
  • Offering advice / support
You can email us on theatreignite@gmail.com

story:
about the book

Hi! We are Sean and Cole Fiscus, the creators of Why Aren’t I Real?, a book of poems and drawings. For years, we have been cooking up masterpieces under the same roof, but haven’t gotten the opportunity to craft a dual series. Now that we are trapped in our homes because of the pandemic, we can finally make our dream a reality. 

What’s the book about, you ask? Great question. You’re kind of putting us on the spot, here, but we can wing it, we suppose. It’s about the side effects of changing your birthday and the benefits of eating spinach. It’s about the wisest man in the world and the least terrifying monster. It’s also about balloons. Mostly balloons. Does that answer your question?

what's inside?

20 poems. 20 drawings. Unless we get excited. 

We will self-publish our book through 48 Hour Books Publishing. It will be a 6 by 9 inch paperback. An ebook will also be available.

about the poet and the drawing guy

Sean Fiscus is a 12th grade student at Mercersburg Academy, where he plays tenor saxophone in the Jazz Band and Concert Band, co-directs the Math and Science Center, and serves as a dormitory prefect. He was also the co-captain of the boys’ varsity soccer team and co-captain of the indoor track and field team, and he is attending Duke University next year. He is our poet. 

Cole Fiscus (last name not a coincidence) is a 9th grader at Allegany High School. He runs cross-country, plays trumpet and guitar, and draws the universe.

Together, they are the dynamic duo. Imagine Batman and Robin, Scooby and Shaggy, and cheese and crackers all squished into one spectacular partnership and made a little bit better. These two are back again with their latest (and first) book, Why Aren’t I Real?. 

about the campaign

We aren’t a typical crowdfunding campaign. This is our first book, and we thought Indiegogo would be a great platform for starting sales and gaining exposure. One of the benefits of this site is the perks system, which, in our case, lets you buy an ebook or a paperback copy on the same platform. 

That being said, if we get loads of book purchases, we will plan on continuing our collaborative endeavor with additional books and maybe search for a publisher. 

other options to help us

If you can’t contribute right now, there are other things you can do to support our work.

First, share this campaign on social media! We are told that Indiegogo has wonderful tools for sharing. 

Cole is also selling t-shirts at https://teespring.com/stores/colenoise.
