story:
“First time I put the red nose on I started to cry unconsciously, I discovered my clown is sad… This made me think in the reasons why and start this whole project!”

“Meet the Clown” is Riham Isaac first comprehensive, independent project which is part of her dream of introducing new live art for the Palestinian audience and worldwide. Riham Isaac would like to spot the light on the honest and transparent human inside the depth of our souls. Most of us live in this world as robots not questioning it, following the rules and beliefs as if it was our truth… but is it really? Is this why we are living?

The clown is the connection to this world!

And yes, Who can be more vulnerable than the clown?!

The clown wants to invite you to her world away from the chaos of life, its rules, problems and isolation. The clown and her nose are all what it takes to create this world that is full of magic, spontaneity, colors, sounds and fantasies. The world of the clown is nonsense and she is trying to make sense out of this life by allowing harmony between her world and the world outside. This Clown wants to show what  is beyond this surface; to say: Meet me… Meet the clown… Meet the clown living this normal life...I am who I am … I am the clown… and I could also be you!!

This project will not be in the traditional form of theater. Audience will take part in this live performance since the moment of their arrival by putting them into certain situations and allow them to start the journey of the clown with different art disciplines; live music and sounds, videos and visuals like installation.

Audience are a very important element in this project and it is directed to all as Riham believes each one of us has their inner clown who has this kind of spontaneity and playfulness which we usually cover with masks we put on each morning to face the surrounding world. But WHY?! We don’t need to put on these masks. We can be just ourselves and act the way we feel good, YES Let’s feel GOOD!

What we need from you?

We are very excited to use the medium of crowdfunding for our production because we love the idea of producing our very first project by funds from friends, family and people all over the world and each one of you being a part of our process and we hope it will make you feel like you own the performance we are aiming to produce.

We have decided to make this project independently and we need your help in funding to appreciate all the efforts that has been done on the artistic and logistic level. For this to happen  we need $6000 for the people working in this project (Performance artist, Musician, Video artist, Project Coordinator), $4000 for technical stuff (rent of camera, projector, lights, sound/sound recordings, filming and documenting and other technical needs, and $3000 for touring our performance in Palestine as our dream is not just to produce the performance but also to reach as much audience as possible in Palestine and hopefully reach 48 areas.

Good news!!! We already have $3000 from A M Qattan Foundation - a respected organization in Palestine, who believed in our project. We are happy as this money will enable us to start In February 2016 however we will need the rest of funds from you to produce it on a high artistic level, premiere it in Bethlehem and then tour with it!!

The Creative TEAM

Riham Isaac (Project Leader and Performance Artist)

 https://rihamisaacportfolio.wordpress.com/

Fares Isaac (Musician)

https://soundcloud.com/lamma-band/larjan

Christin Hodali (Project Coordinator and Fundraiser)


We are currently three however we are soon to find a video artist to join the team and hopefully a Dramaturge.

How can you support us!!

If you are not able to support us with money you still can help and spread the project worldwide by sharing our campaign’s link with your friends on your social media accounts and ask your friends to share it with their friends in order to reach as much people as possible around the world.


WE ARE GRATEFUL and THANK YOU VERY MUCH

We are very happy that this project is taking shape and we hope we will put our creative positive energy in creating something new challenging and brave. And that you will be part of it!!


We also know it is not easy to get funding for individual artists’ project but that’s why we are using this medium of crowd funding, because we believe that you can make our dream come true!

Thank you In Advance!!

And….

For all the people who has joined our family and helped us so far in making this campaign and our project come true from different artists, friends and family…We thank you one by one  and we hope we didn’t forget anyone!!

Rabab Haj Yahya (Editor of the Campaign Video)

Fuad Hindieh (Camera Man of the Campaign Video)

Stephen Ticsay (Photographer of the above photos)

Daniel Banoura, Ragheda Andoni, Saed Andoni, Eihab Isaac, Helle siljeholm, George Slibi, Jehad Afghani, Ayed Arafeh, Rafat Lafi, Karim Kattan, Victoria Dabdoub, Reem Shraydeh, Singer Cafe, Beit Sahour Medical Center, Dar Alnadwa Theater - Rania Salsa, A M Qattan Foundation, Hosh Jasmin, Palestinian Circus School - Shadi Zomorrod.

story:
Last Christmas, I gave you fine art, 

But the very next day, you gave it away. 

This year, to save me from tears, 

I’m giving you something conceptual. 

This Christmas Home Live Art and Richard DeDomenici are putting the fun back into festive fundraising.


Who we are and what we're doing

Home Live Art is a UK based arts organisation who produces live art events in the public realm. From festivals, large-scale outdoor events to curating work in domestic houses, Home Live Art has collaborated with an array of independent artists since 1999. One such artist is film maker and self styled raconteur Richard DeDomenici.

In summer 2015, Richard decided it was time to make a record but a record with a difference! Entitled Live Art Aid, Richard’s record would be a charity single released in time for Christmas!

Richard invited 20 artists to the famous Major Tom music studios in London to record Live Art Aid, a song co-written with artists Bryony Kimmings and Tom Parkinson which is designed to raise money for, and awareness of, live artists in the UK. We’re now selling the record as a download or limited edition vinyl.

Purposefully tongue in check but with a serious message, Live Art Aid aims to explain what live art is to the tune of Do They Know It’s Christmas played backwards and all within 4 minutes!

There is a fundraising target of £4,000 and all money raised will be re-distributed between the 20 artists who contributed to the record .

It's a cause Richard feels strongly about, with the creator noting, “Live Art is one of the most uncommercial art genres in the world, and is in danger of becoming extinct. We’re like pandas in that respect - barely able to sustain ourselves, and hardly ever having sex. Except most people have heard of pandas”  


The Serious Bit - Why support Live Art Aid?

The fact is, with ever tightening budgets and shrinking resources, it’s becoming increasingly difficult for independent, self -employed artists to sustain themselves -so the idea behind Live Art Aid is very simple; help us raise a small amount of money to provide an artist with cash support to spark a new idea.

Of course, £200 can’t make a finished work – but this modest amount can help seed an idea, test a hunch or pilot an experiment. And these ideas could become projects which you end up seeing.


What we need and how you can help us

We want to raise £4000 in 40 days.

This means the 20 participating artists will each receive £200. That's nothing we hear you say! But don't underestimate what £200 could do -  it could pay for rehearsal space for a weekend, pay for 2 long-distance train journeys enabling an artist to meet with venues and curators, it could even cover the airfare to a European Festival enabling an artist to present their work.

DeDomenici - described by many as a scruffy Bob Geldof but more annoying and less talented - says the record is a last ditch attempt to radically improve the deteriorating funding landscape for live artists. 

“If this doesn’t work I’m planning to open a Live Art speakeasy” he threatens. 


What you get in return

Live Art Aid features a host of great perks to thank you for your support. From personal thanks and kisses to a signed, limited edition vinyl record. Each 7-inch vinyl will be hand-numbered by Richard, with his left hand, and features an exclusive b-side featuring Richard and one Live Art Aid co-writer Bryony Kimmings.  Because it takes a while to press vinyl, the record will be available in January 2016 - a great way to start the new year with a cheery song!

The song is available from December the 1st in a digital download format

We have 300 limited edition, hand-numbered 7-inch vinyl records on offer (for those without a record player, each vinyl copy comes with a handy hole in the middle for affixing to the wall with a hammer). Each vinyl comes with specially designed sleeve and is hand-numbered by Richard using his left hand.

If you don't have a permanent address, or live in rented accommodation where you aren’t allowed to make holes in your walls, various bits of associated merchandise, such as mugs, t-shirts and personal thanks are also available.


Other ways you can help

The more people that know about Live Art Aid, the more likely we are to reach our goal. Please share this campaign and tweet your support with #LiveArtAid. 

The artists involved with Live Art Aid are:

Francesca Baglione, Katy Baird, Andy Field, Figs in Wigs,  Anna Goodman, Catherine Hoffmann, Nicki Hobday, Kazuko Hohki, Mamoru Iriguchi, Bryony Kimmings, Brian Lobel, Eilidh MacAskill, Stacy Makishi, Lucy McCormick, Tom Parkinson, Deborah Pearson, Daniel Oliver, Louise Orwin,      Xavier de Sousa, Ellie Stamp. 

Live Art Aid was an original commission by Home Live Art, supported through their Arts Council England Catalyst programme.

story:
BARE |

"contribute to a movement worth celebrating" 

Who |

Giulia (27 years old) and Tori (24) first met and instantly bonded over their shared experiences and struggles with both body image, and self esteem. Through this true raw and honest conversation, a powerful friendship and sisterhood was born. Passionate about the impact of how a single conversation can foster meaningful relationships and a safe space to be one's authentic self, Giulia and Tori set out to share their message with as many people as they could. Their goal: to inspire others through vulnerability, to continue this powerful conversation and most importantly to create a movement of a collective confidence not only within our community, but with the world. 
All it takes is one honest conversation.

What | How

Through powerful conversation and self-expression through art, we will set the stage for our audience to powerfully engage in raw conversations and support the movement of creating a collective confidence.

Stemming from our own personal struggles with body image and self-confidence, we will be speaking to educate, inspire and empower our audience. Our goal is for everyone to leave with a new appreciation for themselves and support what is known as a, collective confidence.

The Impact |

This event is an educative, experiential and celebratory evening. Both of us are extremely passionate about this cause, and know that in creating a safe space for conversation education and inspiration - that this message will carry weight and incredible value for all involved. 

How You Can Support |

We are asking for your support in the form of a donation to help us bring this event to life. We felt strongly about ensuring that our event was free, for anyone to attend and for that reason, we have some costs that we would love your support with.  
We are committed to creating a safe space for our community to come together, to create something powerful together and most importantly to celebrate.
We are really passionate about delivering a true celebration and an incredible experience for all of our attendees. We will be serving wine, food, and keeping the vibe alive with a fantastic live band! 

Other Ways You Can Help |

Our event will be held on November 27th, 2015 in Vancouver BC. Formal invitations will be distributed in upcoming weeks, and we would love your support. If you aren't able to make it, consider donating to this noteworthy cause and/or contribute by supporting a conversation of this measure in your community. 

Thank you so much for your support, 

With love and gratitude, 

Giulia & Tori

(photograph: Alexa Mazzarello)

story:
Poetry In The Heart of Jamestown

It is amazing what experiences await you on a seemingly random weeknight, in a small, dusty corner of Western, NY. Yet, when you begin to wander the brick alley-ways of downtown Jamestown, it is nearly impossible to deny the subtle scent of possibility drifting around the crumbling corners of these resolute landmarks. There is a feeling that this city is equal parts inescapable decay and incredible progress; a sense of wonder that brings you back into the heart of Jamestown again and again. There are things to be discovered at every turn. Atmospheric and alluring local artists hiding in the shadows, hoping to break the steel and empty silence of an ordinary day. It was only in recent years that the Pulse Poetry Slam was born to bring these artists together. Pulse Poetry events have grown to feature live acoustic music and comedy, and at the core of these events, provide Jamestown with it's only monthly poetry slam event, which combines the excitement of a contest with the emotional, intelligent, and creatively driven performances of some of the finest poets in this area. Since 2014, Pulse has hosted nearly 30 events at 7 different local venues. 

 

Infinity

Phoenix Rising

                               

 Jones Valhalla

(Infinity hosts a Pulse Poetry event on the 1st Thursday of every month. Phoenix Rising is home to Fire Nights, a music and poetry slam series by Pulse that falls on the 3rd Monday of every month. Previous venues also include SUNY JCC, Havana, Chautauqua Music, and the James Prendergast Library.)

Each event is unique in it's growing ability to draw people of all ages and backgrounds into the community, and oftentimes, onto the stage. A constant and forever crucial aspect of the Pulse Poetry Slam is the core body of poets who have supported this endeavor since the beginning.

   

So much of the growth that Pulse has achieved has been the result of the ceaseless love and support of members of this community, just like you.

  

  

#ThisIsYourPulse: Giving Back

This campaign has been launched in the hopes that Pulse will be able to give back to everyone in the end. With this support, we will be able to accomplish many things, such as:

  1. Fund a platform for which Pulse will be able to spotlight these poets and artists, in an effort to reward them for their earnestness & showcase their thriving talents.
  2. Pay them for their performances at such a showcase. Performance poetry is an art form, and these artists are worthy of backing for every one of their endeavors.
  3. Provide Jamestown with more incomparable events, and further contribute to the growth of the arts community in this area. 
We look forward to showing our appreciation to each and every individual that makes a contribution to this endeavor! There are great perks available to you, even if you only donate $1. Throughout the course of this campaign, we will be giving away some Pulse goodies like: vouchers for free access into our events, custom t-shirts, buttons, vinyl stickers, coffee mugs, & more! Many thanks to our friends at Tru Media Solutions for providing quality, local craftsmanship and products to Pulse.

   

       

Even if we do not reach our entire goal, we will continue to sustain an exciting experience for our artists and our community. Whatever funds we raise will contribute to the growth and bettering of our event series.


The Impact

Contributing to this campaign will change the game for the poets, artists, and members of this community that have experienced first-hand the incredible energy, encouragement, acceptance, and love that Pulse has thrived on since the very beginning. See for yourself what impact has already been made, and how supporting Pulse could bring this movement to entirely new heights:


"I had gone to two Pulse Poetry open mics before competing in my first slam. Everyone was so kind and supportive, and the room was full of talented performers. Autumn most certainly made me feel welcome and appreciated as soon as I stepped in. The overwhelming support and love from the audience and fellow performers was heartwarming each time I've competed. Pulse is a loving community of talented people and I'm so glad to be a part of it!" - Kassandra Kum, two time Pulse Poetry Slam champion, pictured below performing at the JCC Interweave/Pulse Poetry Slam collaboration event.                                       

"Pulse Poetry Slam is the best thing in Jamestown you don't know about. It's been running for over a year, and in that short time, it's amassed a group of faithful regulars, as well as new people at almost every event. Autumn Echo, Pulse's founder and slam master, strives to make slams fresh and new by holding events at different venues, changing up the judging format, and inviting local musicians to perform. We've had events at restaurants, a yoga studio, and a music shop, and they've all been incredible in unique ways. At Pulse Poetry Slam, there's a feeling of closeness and family, especially between the  poets. We support each other, bounce ideas off of each other, and try to strengthen our skills together. I've made some truly wonderful friends through Pulse events, and met some brilliant minds. Pulse is also audience-friendly. Autumn Echo just recently changed the judging format to include all audience members, and so far, it's been awesome. In short, if you're not going to Pulse Poetry Slam, what are you doing?" - Pulse Poet Elise Etc., pictured below performing at the Pulse Poetry One Year Celebration at Infinity Visual and Performing Arts.                                                                                                  

 


"There is a growing yet still underlying sapling of art sprouted here in Jamestown within the last year. In an area with roots set deep into the history of art, now comes one more seedling shooting up beneath this concrete forest. Pulse Poetry is pioneering the first ever vessel of performance poetry the Jamestown area has ever seen. Pulse welcomes all and encourages members of the community to get involved by not only writing their own original works, but also bringing them to life on stage in front of an audience in the form of performance art. And even still, if writing poetry is not your forté, attending Pulse events as merely an audience member makes for a well spent night out. It educates the community and raises awareness to this art all while thoroughly entertaining and inspiring so many as it does. Performance poetry contains a long history but has been across the nation a very abstract medium only to just recently see a rise in mainstream popularity. Due to the efforts of founder and host Autumn Echo, a brilliant performance poet herself, Jamestown area can now be proud to have a place this art form can reside in. She is truly a light shining through the darker corners growing long in this city. So for those who have condemned Jamestown and lost hope, Pulse can truly be a reminder that valiant efforts are being made to change things for the better. Pulse is an environment for those seeking refuge and understanding of oneself and the world around them through alternative methods of expressing oneself. It is safe and supportive. It is beginnings and family. Pulse is home. I personally will forever owe Pulse much gratitude and recognition for my start into performance poetry. All of my success in poetry, current and future alike, will be due to the existence of Pulse Poetry." - Rycheigh Allan, Pulse Poet and 1st place winner of multiple Pulse Poetry Slams, pictured below performing at Chautauqua Music.


"Pulse Poetry Slam is no longer just a friendly competition between poets. It's a home. A judgement free community where we can put our hearts on our sleeves and feel relief for a moment from anything else that may be happening in our everyday lives. It's a place where I can lay my emotions on stage and get support from people I've never met before. It's nothing but positive vibes from an amazing group of artists. I'm proud to say that I have been a part of its growth and can not wait to see what surprises are in store for the future of the Pulse Poetry Slam." - Pulse Poet Autumn Bradley, pictured below performing at Infinity Visual and Performing Arts during the Pulse Poetry One Year Celebration.

 


"You don't have to be a poet, or even a fan of poetry, to enjoy an evening with Pulse. You only have to be looking for an evening of brilliant entertainment. The atmosphere at Pulse Poetry events is very friendly and comforting. If you're looking for a quiet evening out with your thoughts, you don't even have to talk to anyone. You can enter quietly and leave just as quietly. Conversely, if you want a bit of thought-provoking and stimulating interaction, you can come in and chat with the poets and other members of the audience. But in either case, when you leave, you will have had a very unique experience. An experience that may touch you in a special way. It may make you cry. It may make you laugh. It will most assuredly make you think. Be prepared to be inspired, educated and amazed. Relax and enjoy an evening with Pulse." - Steve Riczker, a frequent audience member and supporter of Pulse.

"The Pulse Poetry Slam is a wonderful way for creative writers and poets to try out material and perform in front of an enthusiastic and encouraging group of people. Autumn runs the events in a lively and effective manner and the energy in the room is positive and supportive. Whether you want to try your hand at sharing your poems or just want to hear some great poetry read by local poets, I would highly recommend that you visit the next Pulse Poetry Slam event to see how fun it all is!" - Kate Ebersole, a Pulse Poetry Slam champion, pictured below performing at the Pulse Poetry One Year Celebration.


"I stumbled upon Pulse Poetry accidentally while visiting Infinity for guitar instruction. I've always enjoyed writing, but never wrote much poetry, nor had I ever dreamed of performing anything I'd written publicly. On a bit of a personal dare I decided to 'give it a shot'. Since taking that shot, I've found out more about myself as a writer and a human being. I've found the confidence to put my thoughts to rhyme and express them in a fashion that I can only characterize as cathartic. I've taken that confidence into other areas of writing and have since had an article about my experience in Iraq published on a military related arts website.  Pulse Poetry is the therapy for all that ails me. Between the people I've met to the demons I've extinguished, Pulse Poetry is priceless and I will forever be thankful for this gift." - Sierra Tango, a frequent performer and supporter of Pulse Poetry Slam events, pictured below performing at the Pulse Poetry One Year Celebration.

    

Sharing Is Caring:

Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help! Take a moment to like the Pulse Poetry Slam Facebook page, follow us on Twitter and Instagram, and share in our efforts to spread the word about this campaign to your friends! We appreciate every single thing that you do for Pulse.
story_txt:
Poetry In The Heart of Jamestown
It is amazing what experiences await you on a seemingly random weeknight, in a small, dusty corner of Western, NY. Yet, when you begin to wander the brick alley-ways of downtown Jamestown, it is nearly impossible to deny the subtle scent of possibility drifting around the crumbling corners of these resolute landmarks. There is a feeling that this city is equal parts inescapable decay and incredible progress; a sense of wonder that brings you back into the heart of Jamestown again and again. There are things to be discovered at every turn. Atmospheric and alluring local artists hiding in the shadows, hoping to break the steel and empty silence of an ordinary day. It was only in recent years that the Pulse Poetry Slam was born to bring these artists together. Pulse Poetry events have grown to feature live acoustic music and comedy, and at the core of these events, provide Jamestown with it's only monthly poetry slam event, which combines the excitement of a contest with the emotional, intelligent, and creatively driven performances of some of the finest poets in this area. Since 2014, Pulse has hosted nearly 30 events at 7 different local venues. 

 
Infinity

Phoenix Rising

                                
 Jones Valhalla
(Infinity hosts a Pulse Poetry event on the 1st Thursday of every month. Phoenix Rising is home to Fire Nights, a music and poetry slam series by Pulse that falls on the 3rd Monday of every month. Previous venues also include SUNY JCC, Havana, Chautauqua Music, and the James Prendergast Library.)

Each event is unique in it's growing ability to draw people of all ages and backgrounds into the community, and oftentimes, onto the stage. A constant and forever crucial aspect of the Pulse Poetry Slam is the core body of poets who have supported this endeavor since the beginning.

   

So much of the growth that Pulse has achieved has been the result of the ceaseless love and support of members of this community, just like you.


  
  



#ThisIsYourPulse: Giving Back
 This campaign has been launched in the hopes that Pulse will be able to give back to everyone in the end. With this support, we will be able to accomplish many things, such as: 
Fund a platform for which Pulse will be able to spotlight these poets and artists, in an effort to reward them for their earnestness & showcase their thriving talents. Pay them for their performances at such a showcase. Performance poetry is an art form, and these artists are worthy of backing for every one of their endeavors. Provide Jamestown with more incomparable events, and further contribute to the growth of the arts community in this area. 
We look forward to showing our appreciation to each and every individual that makes a contribution to this endeavor! There are great perks available to you, even if you only donate $1. Throughout the course of this campaign, we will be giving away some Pulse goodies like: vouchers for free access into our events, custom t-shirts, buttons, vinyl stickers, coffee mugs, & more! Many thanks to our friends at Tru Media Solutions for providing quality, local craftsmanship and products to Pulse.

   
       
Even if we do not reach our entire goal, we will continue to sustain an exciting experience for our artists and our community. Whatever funds we raise will contribute to the growth and bettering of our event series.

The Impact
 Contributing to this campaign will change the game for the poets, artists, and members of this community that have experienced first-hand the incredible energy, encouragement, acceptance, and love that Pulse has thrived on since the very beginning. See for yourself what impact has already been made, and how supporting Pulse could bring this movement to entirely new heights:

"I had gone to two Pulse Poetry open mics before competing in my first slam. Everyone was so kind and supportive, and the room was full of talented performers. Autumn most certainly made me feel welcome and appreciated as soon as I stepped in. The overwhelming support and love from the audience and fellow performers was heartwarming each time I've competed. Pulse is a loving community of talented people and I'm so glad to be a part of it!" - Kassandra Kum, two time Pulse Poetry Slam champion, pictured below performing at the JCC Interweave/Pulse Poetry Slam collaboration event.                                       


"Pulse Poetry Slam is the best thing in Jamestown you don't know about. It's been running for over a year, and in that short time, it's amassed a group of faithful regulars, as well as new people at almost every event. Autumn Echo, Pulse's founder and slam master, strives to make slams fresh and new by holding events at different venues, changing up the judging format, and inviting local musicians to perform. We've had events at restaurants, a yoga studio, and a music shop, and they've all been incredible in unique ways. At Pulse Poetry Slam, there's a feeling of closeness and family, especially between the  poets. We support each other, bounce ideas off of each other, and try to strengthen our skills together. I've made some truly wonderful friends through Pulse events, and met some brilliant minds. Pulse is also audience-friendly. Autumn Echo just recently changed the judging format to include all audience members, and so far, it's been awesome. In short, if you're not going to Pulse Poetry Slam, what are you doing?" - Pulse Poet Elise Etc., pictured below performing at the Pulse Poetry One Year Celebration at Infinity Visual and Performing Arts.                                                                                                  
 



"There is a growing yet still underlying sapling of art sprouted here in Jamestown within the last year. In an area with roots set deep into the history of art, now comes one more seedling shooting up beneath this concrete forest. Pulse Poetry is pioneering the first ever vessel of performance poetry the Jamestown area has ever seen. Pulse welcomes all and encourages members of the community to get involved by not only writing their own original works, but also bringing them to life on stage in front of an audience in the form of performance art. And even still, if writing poetry is not your forté, attending Pulse events as merely an audience member makes for a well spent night out. It educates the community and raises awareness to this art all while thoroughly entertaining and inspiring so many as it does. Performance poetry contains a long history but has been across the nation a very abstract medium only to just recently see a rise in mainstream popularity. Due to the efforts of founder and host Autumn Echo, a brilliant performance poet herself, Jamestown area can now be proud to have a place this art form can reside in. She is truly a light shining through the darker corners growing long in this city. So for those who have condemned Jamestown and lost hope, Pulse can truly be a reminder that valiant efforts are being made to change things for the better. Pulse is an environment for those seeking refuge and understanding of oneself and the world around them through alternative methods of expressing oneself. It is safe and supportive. It is beginnings and family. Pulse is home. I personally will forever owe Pulse much gratitude and recognition for my start into performance poetry. All of my success in poetry, current and future alike, will be due to the existence of Pulse Poetry." - Rycheigh Allan, Pulse Poet and 1st place winner of multiple Pulse Poetry Slams, pictured below performing at Chautauqua Music.


"Pulse Poetry Slam is no longer just a friendly competition between poets. It's a home. A judgement free community where we can put our hearts on our sleeves and feel relief for a moment from anything else that may be happening in our everyday lives. It's a place where I can lay my emotions on stage and get support from people I've never met before. It's nothing but positive vibes from an amazing group of artists. I'm proud to say that I have been a part of its growth and can not wait to see what surprises are in store for the future of the Pulse Poetry Slam." - Pulse Poet Autumn Bradley, pictured below performing at Infinity Visual and Performing Arts during the Pulse Poetry One Year Celebration.
 

"You don't have to be a poet, or even a fan of poetry, to enjoy an evening with Pulse. You only have to be looking for an evening of brilliant entertainment. The atmosphere at Pulse Poetry events is very friendly and comforting. If you're looking for a quiet evening out with your thoughts, you don't even have to talk to anyone. You can enter quietly and leave just as quietly. Conversely, if you want a bit of thought-provoking and stimulating interaction, you can come in and chat with the poets and other members of the audience. But in either case, when you leave, you will have had a very unique experience. An experience that may touch you in a special way. It may make you cry. It may make you laugh. It will most assuredly make you think. Be prepared to be inspired, educated and amazed. Relax and enjoy an evening with Pulse." - Steve Riczker, a frequent audience member and supporter of Pulse.




"The Pulse Poetry Slam is a wonderful way for creative writers and poets to try out material and perform in front of an enthusiastic and encouraging group of people. Autumn runs the events in a lively and effective manner and the energy in the room is positive and supportive. Whether you want to try your hand at sharing your poems or just want to hear some great poetry read by local poets, I would highly recommend that you visit the next Pulse Poetry Slam event to see how fun it all is!" - Kate Ebersole, a Pulse Poetry Slam champion, pictured below performing at the Pulse Poetry One Year Celebration.


"I stumbled upon Pulse Poetry accidentally while visiting Infinity for guitar instruction. I've always enjoyed writing, but never wrote much poetry, nor had I ever dreamed of performing anything I'd written publicly. On a bit of a personal dare I decided to 'give it a shot'. Since taking that shot, I've found out more about myself as a writer and a human being. I've found the confidence to put my thoughts to rhyme and express them in a fashion that I can only characterize as cathartic. I've taken that confidence into other areas of writing and have since had an article about my experience in Iraq published on a military related arts website.  Pulse Poetry is the therapy for all that ails me. Between the people I've met to the demons I've extinguished, Pulse Poetry is priceless and I will forever be thankful for this gift." - Sierra Tango, a frequent performer and supporter of Pulse Poetry Slam events, pictured below performing at the Pulse Poetry One Year Celebration.

    



Sharing Is Caring:
Even if you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help! Take a moment to like the Pulse Poetry Slam Facebook page, follow us on Twitter and Instagram, and share in our efforts to spread the word about this campaign to your friends! We appreciate every single thing that you do for Pulse.

story:
Short Summary

We are building a large-scale, interactive art project that combines a triple spiral labyrinth with the transformative aspects of shamanic initiation. The three core members of the team are 'Natara, Angie, and Celina. We come from diverse backgrounds, and together we bring a strong background in neo-shamanism, teaching, large-scale art, project management, and personal transformation.

The project creates positive, powerful, personal change for everyone who has gotten involved. Our society lacks opportunities for visceral mystical experiences that don't require drugs or years of study, and we don't always remember to celebrate our transformational experiences. We also have found that the local communities and schools don't have a lot of contact with interactive art, so this will fill a real and present need.

The project will be open to the public and self-guided. The opportunity to use it as a resource for workshops, of course, exists, but we wanted to create something that people could access when they need to and when they want to. When people process their experience in the after-care area, whether through art or words, they will be adding to the richness of the project, and others will benefit from those who came before them.


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for funding and physical assistance, as well as in-kind donations. The money will cover the build and upkeep for several years, at which point we foresee if being self-supporting. We plan on doing the initial, foundational build over the second weekend in January, and we invite as many people as would like to come down, help out, and experience the magic of the site. In keeping with the recycling ethos of East Jesus, in-kind donation requests include old plastic grocery bags, unwearable clothing items, and old wind chimes and mobiles.

We estimate needing about $5000, which will cover cement, poles, poultry fencing, wire, the pyramid, a cover and supplies for the after-care/decompression/processing space, solar lights, stones for the grid, rental or purchase of any tools we can't borrow, and ongoing upkeep for the next few years. All labor is donated, and we are borrowing as many of the tools as we can, and upcycling/recycling/repurposing materials wherever possible. If we do not reach our goal, all of the collected money will still go into the project, it will just take us longer to get things done.

For people who come and help us build in January, we will be facilitating an interfaith new moon ritual on Saturday night, where people can set their intentions for 2016. We invite everyone to bring a symbol of empowerment for the altar, as the energies will be conducive to fostering personal empowerment, self realization, and strong forward motion.

Donors will have the opportunity to participate in one of our future on-site workshops and will have their names listed as donors on our website. Other perks include a limited edition collectors' item merit badge, a digital copy of our gluten-free cooking for the holidays cookbook, and a finger labyrinth.

Who We Are

'Natara has been teaching meditation and transformational workshops for over 20 years, and put together a team to build a smaller labyrinth as a one day project earlier in 2015.

Celina is a professional chef, specializing in eating restrictions, and has a background in project management with one of the largest entertainment companies in the world.

Angie works in health care and has been on her own intense shamanic path for several years.

Other people coming together to help bring this project to reality include business owners, artists, students, and teachers from all walks of life and all spiritual paths.


Risks & Challenges

One of our biggest challenges in this El Nino year is going to be weather. It's hard to lay and cure concrete when it's actively raining. It's always a good idea to be flexible with your timing when working in partnership with Mother Nature, and we are aware that the project may run long because of this. Luckily, we don't think it's going to increase our costs in any significant way.

We are planning our construction with the elements and climate in mind, and the final product should require only minimal upkeep, mostly replenishing art supplies and occasionally replacing construction materials.

Vandalism is a concern, but the installation is in full view of the residential section of East Jesus, so we probably won't be terribly vulnerable. Everything we're using should be easily replaceable and no terribly valuable to thieves.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate money right now? You can still help us out.

(1) Come help us build! If you can't make it the second weekend in January, but still want to help in the future, drop a note to labyrinth@ayamanatara.com and we'll keep you apprised of future work weekends.

(2) Have a collection of plastic grocery bags you haven't recycled yet? We would love them! The walls and ceiling of the tunnels will be made from various materials woven through poultry fencing, and plastic bags are great for that. Old clothes that can't go to charity are also great for the tunnel construction, as long as they haven't come into contact with animal waste. Likewise for ribbons, mylar, weird fabric you don't know what to do with, and anything else that can be woven through poultry fencing.

(3) We are looking to have a lot of wind chimes, and wood or shell mobiles that make noise in the breeze, to create a soundscape. We are also collecting bottles for a wind-powered sound sculpture that will go in one corner of the site, so any interesting and sturdy bottles will also be appreciated. Any of those that we don't use can still be used in the bottle wall on the far side of East Jesus.

(4) If you are part of a foundation that makes charitable contributions, especially to art, community-building projects, or spiritual causes, East Jesus is a 501C3.

And, of course...
(5) Get the word out! Please share this campaign, talk about it, write about it, post about it... Let everyone know.

story:
HEADS UP delves into the widely misunderstood subject of vaginal breech delivery. 

The Issue

At birth, about 4% of babies in the United States are in a breech presentation—that’s about one breech birth every 4 minutes.  Up until 2001, vaginal delivery was an option for women with babies in a breech presentation.  Then, a study was published which concluded that breech babies have a small but statistically significant better outcome with surgical delivery vs. vaginal delivery.  Based on that, the guidelines of the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists (ACOG) recommended cesarean delivery be scheduled for all breech babies, usually at 39 weeks gestation.  This study and subsequent guideline update had major effects, essentially obliterating the option of vaginal delivery- and thereby parent's choices.

The research and logic upon which we stopped offering breech delivery is faulty. Current ACOG guidelines, changed in 2006, support vaginal breech delivery but presume you will have a cesarean section anyway due to diminishing expertise among physicians trained in vaginal breech delivery.  As a result, nearly 175,000 women and their babies in the United State each year are given no choice but cesarean section. If we don’t seek change now, the diminishing expertise will soon be impossible to overcome. 

Cesarean section is not the demon; it is a medical innovation that saves lives. However, overuse of cesarean section does more harm than good, and pushing unwanted cesarean sections that are also unnecessary is downright evil.  Today, we bring you an opportunity to dramatically reverse the growing push for surgical birth in low risk pregnancies.  


HEADS UP: The Disappearing Art Of Vaginal Breech Delivery

HEADS UP  aims to debunk the breech C-section myth.  We want women and doctors alike to know that options still remain, but those options will surely disappear if we don’t take action.  Several of the doctors who have seen our film wish they had better training.  Were it not for that one 2001 study, vaginal breech delivery would still be taught and practiced more widely.

The ultimate goal of this film is to to educate women and their partners and empower them with information that is often not widely available about birth options. Empowered with information, parents will be better prepared to make informed choices in pregnancy, childbirth and early parenting.  

We are thrilled to partner with the nonprofit organization From The Heart Productions.

This film, and the films to follow in an education series, will exist as a public resource and will live on Dr. Berlin’s Informed Pregnancy® website, available to anyone at anytime, anywhere.

Become Part of the Story

The film is nearly complete, having been produced as a labor of love with deep personal investments of time, talent, and funds, but in order to finish post-production and distribute the film, we must raise a real budget.  The budget will cover such items as:

-Post-production costs for HEADS UP (score composition, sound mix, color correction, film premiere, festival expenses)

-Distribution costs for HEADS UP - making a film is great.  Getting it seen is where it develops power to influence change and restore options

-Management costs for HEADS UP - such as film insurance and expenses for musical score and visual elements

If we raise more than our goal, we will be able to do more:

-Production costs (including pre- and post-) for the next documentary in the series 

-Designing and building the website that will house these videos and exist as a permanent, free resource for the public

Above all, we are passionate about presenting the facts—and the little known information that options do exist.  We invite you to join us as we take steps to create this series of honest documentaries on the rapidly changing world of modern childbirth. 

We simply can’t do this alone, and neither can you; by working together, we can make a difference and move towards honest, informed change and practices.  

Our Team + Mission

Dr. Elliot Berlin is an award-winning prenatal chiropractor, childbirth educator, and labor doula. His Informed Pregnancy® Project aims to utilize multiple forms of media to compile and deliver unbiased information about pregnancy and childbirth to empower new and expectant parents to make informed choices regarding their pregnancy and parenting journey.   Media include Dr. Berlin's Informed Pregnancy Magazine, the Informed Pregnancy Podcast, and a feature length film on modern childbirth  from the mother's perspective.

Mel Kennedy-Morrow is a seasoned storyteller with 20 years of experience directing and producing reality television and creating documentary, science, and lifestyle programming for US broadcast and cable outlets including ABC Network, Bravo, A&E, MTV, The Biography Channel, Discovery Channel, Discovery Science, E!, HGTV, History Channel, Lifetime, MSNBC, TLC, Travel Channel, and National Geographic Channel. Mel has cultivated programs about everything from love in the mafia to the art of murder interrogation, from cutting edge advances in water recycling to surviving juvie to what it means to be a millennial woman in America today. Her work inspires audiences to revel and rethink, to laugh in joy and cry in anguish, and really question what it means to be human.  

After experiencing a traumatic emergency cesarean section and fighting to have a VBAC (Vaginal Birth After Cesarean), Mel realized firsthand the limits of modern maternity care. She teamed up with Dr. Berlin to launch a series of Informed Pregnancy short films to explore specific topics in modern maternity care. The first, Heads Up: The Disappearing Art Of Vaginal Breech Delivery, is set to premiere on Mother’s Day 2015 if we can raise the funds needed for completion.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate financially to our campaign but wish to help, please help us spread the word about our project.  You can share our campaign link via social media (using the Indiegogo share tools), by emailing a friend, or by using good old-fashioned word-of-mouth.

The time to act is now… before some of the lesser-known childbirth options do indeed become obsolete. 

We can only effect change by working together; we hope you’ll join us.

Our sincere thanks,

Elliot Berlin and Mel Kennedy-Morrow

Current ACOG guidelines, changed in 2006, support vaginal breech delivery but presume you will have a cesarean section anyway due to diminishing expertise among physicians trained in vaginal breech delivery.  As a result, nearly 175,000 women and their babies in the United State each year are given no choice but cesarean section. If we don’t seek change now, the diminishing expertise will soon be impossible to overcome. Cesarean section is not the demon; it is a medical innovation that saves lives. However, overuse of cesarean section does more harm than good, and pushing unwanted cesarean sections that are also unnecessary is downright evil.  Today, we bring you an opportunity to dramatically reverse the growing push for surgical birth in low risk pregnancies.  HEADS UP: The Disappearing Art Of Vaginal Breech DeliveryHEADS UP  aims to debunk the breech C-section myth.  We want women and doctors alike to know that options still remain, but those options will surely disappear if we don’t take action.  Several of the doctors who have seen our film wish they had better training.  Were it not for that one 2001 study, vaginal breech delivery would still be taught and practiced more widely.The ultimate goal of this film is to to educate women and their partners and empower them with information that is often not widely available about birth options. Empowered with information, parents will be better prepared to make informed choices in pregnancy, childbirth and early parenting.  We are thrilled to partner with the nonprofit organization From The Heart Productions.This film, and the films to follow in an education series, will exist as a public resource and will live on Dr. Berlin’s Informed Pregnancy® website, available to anyone at anytime, anywhere.Become Part of the StoryThe film is nearly complete, having been produced as a labor of love with deep personal investments of time, talent, and funds, but in order to finish post-production and distribute the film, we must raise a real budget.  The budget will cover such items as:-Post-production costs for HEADS UP (score composition, sound mix, color correction, film premiere, festival expenses)-Distribution costs for HEADS UP - making a film is great.  Getting it seen is where it develops power to influence change and restore options-Management costs for HEADS UP - such as film insurance and expenses for musical score and visual elementsIf we raise more than our goal, we will be able to do more:-Production costs (including pre- and post-) for the next documentary in the series -Designing and building the website that will house these videos and exist as a permanent, free resource for the publicAbove all, we are passionate about presenting the facts—and the little known information that options do exist.  We invite you to join us as we take steps to create this series of honest documentaries on the rapidly changing world of modern childbirth. We simply can’t do this alone, and neither can you; by working together, we can make a difference and move towards honest, informed change and practices.  Our Team + Mission

Dr. Elliot Berlin is an award-winning prenatal chiropractor, childbirth educator, and labor doula. His Informed Pregnancy® Project aims to utilize multiple forms of media to compile and deliver unbiased information about pregnancy and childbirth to empower new and expectant parents to make informed choices regarding their pregnancy and parenting journey.   Media include Dr. Berlin's Informed Pregnancy Magazine, the Informed Pregnancy Podcast, and a feature length film on modern childbirth  from the mother's perspective.


Mel Kennedy-Morrow is a seasoned storyteller with 20 years of experience directing and producing reality television and creating documentary, science, and lifestyle programming for US broadcast and cable outlets including ABC Network, Bravo, A&E, MTV, The Biography Channel, Discovery Channel, Discovery Science, E!, HGTV, History Channel, Lifetime, MSNBC, TLC, Travel Channel, and National Geographic Channel. Mel has cultivated programs about everything from love in the mafia to the art of murder interrogation, from cutting edge advances in water recycling to surviving juvie to what it means to be a millennial woman in America today. Her work inspires audiences to revel and rethink, to laugh in joy and cry in anguish, and really question what it means to be human.  
After experiencing a traumatic emergency cesarean section and fighting to have a VBAC (Vaginal Birth After Cesarean), Mel realized firsthand the limits of modern maternity care. She teamed up with Dr. Berlin to launch a series of Informed Pregnancy short films to explore specific topics in modern maternity care. The first, Heads Up: The Disappearing Art Of Vaginal Breech Delivery, is set to premiere on Mother’s Day 2015 if we can raise the funds needed for completion.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to donate financially to our campaign but wish to help, please help us spread the word about our project.  You can share our campaign link via social media (using the Indiegogo share tools), by emailing a friend, or by using good old-fashioned word-of-mouth.
The time to act is now… before some of the lesser-known childbirth options do indeed become obsolete. 
We can only effect change by working together; we hope you’ll join us.


Our sincere thanks,
Elliot Berlin and Mel Kennedy-Morrow

story:
CASTEL ESPACES ÉVÉNEMENTS

VILLENEUVE LES AVIGNON, FranceArt

Créer en 1989 par Philippe CABASSUD, avec plus de 25 ans d'expérience dans la réception de groupe, le Castel est le lieu incontournable de tous vos événements. Dans un Domaine atypique et prestigieux, situé au cœur de la Provence, à 5 minutes d'Avignon (40 min de Salon de Provence, d'Orange et de Nîmes), vous apprécierez le cadre privilégié d'un magnifique Mas de type provençal avec piscine et parc arboré.

Notre activité est structurée sur 4 axes.

Organisateur de réception de mariage : Avec plus de 1000 organisations de mariages & d'événements privés à son actif, Castel Espaces Événements et ses Partenaires sont un gage de réussite pour des événements uniques et exceptionnels

Soirées Cabaret : Tout au long de l'année le Castel vous propose aussi ses soirées cabaret  «Diner dansant et Spectacle », ces moments féeriques sont imaginés et chorégraphiés par Stéphane Loras. Que vous soyez en couple en famille ou en groupe, dès votre arrivée, vous plongerez dans l'univers du Music-Hall, pour un moment inoubliable. Possibilité de privatisation des lieux !!!!N'hésitez plus ! Poussez la porte du Castel !!!

Entreprises et comités d’entreprises : Notre équipe prend en charge l’organisation complète, Incentive, Séminaire, Evènements d’entreprise.

Autocaristes et Associations : Nous proposons du Stop étapes et du réceptif, marché en pleine évolution.

Nous avons notre propre service traiteur pour assurer nos réceptions.

 

.

story:
About Tim's project:

WHAT: I am raising $2,000 to fund a mission trip to fly to my mothers island Hawaii Island to assist for the evacuation effort on the other side on Pahoa and help tell the story with my own camera.

WHY: A man on Craigslist posted for help seeking assistance to move away his life's belongings from his property to somewhere safe from the lava path.

HOW: I'm teaming up with local journalists to story of island residents and inspire anyone to help with this ongoing threat to the people and lives of Pahoa. They understand Madam Pele can reclaim her land at any time but that isn't without burdens and strife and we will do our best to help.

YOU: Not everyone can give, but everyone can give something. Give a thought, a prayer for these in the path of the lava flow.

PROJECTED BUDGET:

Airfare to Hawaii Island -- $400 

Housing / Travel Costs -- $300 

Swag for Donors/Backers -- $300 

Indiegogo Fee % -- $150



THE SWAG (BACKER REWARDS):

Pledge $10 or more

 Limited reward (Only 15 Available)

Hawaii Lava Postcard + Thank You Note


Pledge $20 or more

Limited reward (Only 20 Available)

Lava Red Greenhouse Hawaii logo sticker. 3" x 2" Die-Cut Vinyl, perfect for indoors or out!




Pledge $40 or more

 25 Available Limited reward

Calender - Year 2015

and

Postcard



Pledge $75 or more

 20 Available - Limited reward 

Hawaii T-Shirt & Postcard & Calender

All rewards will as specified or with slight changes. 


SELECT COMMUNITY VIDEO ABOUT THE LAVA FLOW:



Thank you for considering helping!

-Tim


Tim Lussier stands on "old" Lava 


Tim Lussier testifies before city council


Lava Photo


For more information about Tim please visit www.TimLussier.org




NOTE: Donor Items will be exact or very similar to ones described above. Also, previous posts mentioned a film project. At this point I am just teaming up with local journalists to tell the story and haven't signed onto any films.

story:
About a month ago, a very good friend of mine gave me a 7 foot tall statue of Jar Jar Binks to hang onto...or sell...or destroy. I decided to do the latter after his mere presence terrified my girlfriend on numerous occasions. 

The money we raise will be used to film a performance art video, depicting the "Murder of Jar Jar Binks." It is our plan to cut off his head, and then set his headless body ablaze in a massive bonfire. Technology permitting, we want to create a live video feed of the event (for which we do not have a set date on...probably will happen sometime in the month of April), but at the very least we will provide everyone who donates with a private YouTube video link of the event. There are many other perks for donations, and we urge you all to check out the full list before deciding on your final donation amount. But every little bit helps, and brings us one step closer to ridding the world of pop culture's most hideous disease.

Any money left over after the cost of the video's production will go to creating the perks promised to donators, and to us, for the severe emotional distress in having lived with Jar Jar Binks for ANY amount of time. Also, we think of it as we're doing the entire world a favor by destroying Jar Jar, so why not make a little coin off it?

Thank you so much for your time and attention. Now let's kill this bastard, shall we?

story:
Finnish Tech, Design & Art (FTDA) Expo in NY May 18th and 19th

Help us showcase the best of Finnish creativity, sustainability and innovation (‘finnovation’) to an American audience.

Why

When Laura and Mintie met a short while ago, we found besides our love for wine, we had a shared passion for Finnish creativity. More specifically, we were both in love with all the great innovation we saw here and frustrated by Finland’s inability to translate that into the global market place. So we decided to combine our thirty-five years of experience in global marketing, media, tech and design to help Finnish creativity finally get the international platform it deserves.

What

Finnish Tech, Design and Art (FTDA) is a non-profit organization that promotes outstanding Finnish creativity to the American market. Our annual event, the Finnish Tech, Design and Art Expo showcases Finnish creativity, sustainability and innovation to an exclusive NY audience of key decision makers, investors and top tier media. Past events have attracted upwards of 800 attendees with a 400 person waiting list. Media exposure has included Time Magazine, Vogue (US) and Elle (US) as well as numerous international online, print and TV outlets.

Where

Finnish people are insanely innovative and intelligent. So are New Yorkers.

FTDA brings Finland to Manhattan with a multi-content exhibition, cocktail gala and a Nordic music night designed to showcase Finnish creativity to an elite audience that includes leaders in tech, design and art as well as investors and media. FTDA Expo capitalizes on the overlap days of NY Design Week and NY Internet Week with its combined 70,000 person audience and international press from 30 + countries. The success of our last two NYC events has led us to extend the 2015 Expo to two days—May 18th & 19th. 

How

We’ve received generous resources from our many partners. However, right now, FTDA is a passion project that Laura and Mintie are funding out of their own pockets. The past two events have been enormous successes where people were exposed to the awesomeness of Finnish design while having a great time with music, food, art and cocktails. So we’re kindly asking you to dig into your wallets and help us make this happen. Any and all contributions are very welcome. Kiitos!

Who

 We’re discovering the best in Finnish designers, artists, techies, gamers, musicians and animators to showcase at FTDA Expo. Check here for constant updates on our list of talent. Here’s who we’ve got lined up so far for May 18 & 19, 2015.


Brands/Artists to be introduced at FTDA Expo 2015 so far:

  • Iron Danger, Film Trailer
  • Susanna Sivonen Design, Textile Design
  • Mintie Das, author of Storm Sisters
  • Sunnuntaipuoti, Fashion and Interior Design
  • Roy Aurinko, Paintings
  • Mari Kasurinen, Sculptures
  • Rauli Mård, Paintings
  • Viivi Huuska, Artist
  • Redder, Band
  • K. Jonas Kernell, Singer & Songwriter


About Us

Laura Avonius is a risk taker who meets any challenge head on. With over eighteen years of experience in global tech and design, Laura has worked her way to the highest levels of international brands like Nokia and Aller Media. While at Nokia, Laura was responsible for bringing solution thinking together, resulting in 200 million active users. Her other expertise lies in turning an idea into a profitable digital business, a skill she put to the test many times as a technical evaluator in Silicon Valley. This is also where Laura cultivated her keen ability in creating lucrative partnerships, pairing up and coming brands with her cultivated rolodex of investors. Laura continues to concentrate her efforts in showcasing Finnish innovation and building successful digital concepts as the founder of FTDA Expo. Currently, Laura serves as the Director of Digital Business at Aller Media. 

Mintie Das is a storyteller with over seventeen years of experience in American corporate PR/Marketing for multinational brands including McDonald’s, Pepsi and the United Nations. She has launched several global press campaigns successfully pitching and placing in national US and global media outlets: US national TV (The View-3 million viewers, Fox & Friends—1.2 m viewers);  US local TV in top 12 markets; print (Harper’s Bazaar, Good Housekeeping) and national radio (ABC Disney); The Verge (15 million unique visitors monthly) and The Guardian (186 K daily). For the last ten years, Mintie has organized annual high-profile VIP events in Dubai, Malta, Macedonia, Bulgaria, India, Hungary, UK and US. In Finland, Mintie consults regularly for Rovio. She recently fulfilled her dream of writing with Rovio’s first young adult book series, Storm Sisters. Storm Sisters: The Sinking World premiered at Frankfurt Book Festival 2014 with over 20 countries interested in purchasing foreign rights and was featured at Berlinale 2015. Storm Sisters is already in its tenth language translation before hitting shelves in late 2015/early 2016.

story:
Hello, my name is...

Chris Gianelloni has been making art for over 25 years now.  Oh, hey, I'm Chris.  It would be silly to talk in the 3rd person for this introduction; therefore, I'm just going to be me and give ya some little life facts about me.

  • Started my art career with crayons and things I shouldn't be drawing on.
  • Grew up to keep enjoying art as a hobby.  As I got older, I thought to myself, "Geeh, this would be cool to do full time."
  • I received art scholarships into high school and college.
  • After school, I started making Flash games full time and that was a lot of fun. 
  • However, I wanted a hobby that got me off the computer and gave me physical pieces of art that I could hang in my house.
  • I started spray painting canvas and other objects with stencils, and I think I got pretty good at it!  (You be the judge!)

So, you may be asking yourself: "Why would I want to back this project?"

Why should I back?

I'll list some reasons I think you should back this project, but feel free to add your own opinions and then back because of those reasons.

  • You'll become a patron of the arts.
  • Y'all get a real life painting at a reasonable price!
  • All the money will go towards what you actually back.  Any other funds will go towards buying new material to make even more art.

Oh NEAT!  What does your stencil canvases look like?


What are the sizes of the canvases?

Sizes vary depending on your perk option.  I normally work in a 1:2 ratio, but I do offer 1:1 ratios and other sizes as well.

  • The depths vary.  I work with 1 1/2" depth canvases a lot, but I also do  my smaller canvases on 7/8" canvases.  It's up to you.
  • There is no limited to the size.  Shipping might cost you an arm and a leg if it's super big, but I'm not apposed to it.

Will you only do stuff on canvas?

I've been asked before if I would do stuff other then just canvases and the answer is yes.

Here are some quick ideas of things I'll paint on for you:

  • Canvas
  • Decks (skateboards)
  • Ceramic tiles
  • Your imagination is the limit


Maybe you think of something that isn't listed in the perks, and you say to yourself, "Golly.  I sure would like IDEA done on MATERIAL."  Message me and we can see how much it'll cost to get done.

Risks & Challenges

I'm pretty quick with my turn around time, but there are risk with anything in life.  Here are a couple...

  • Breathing in too many fumes from the spray paint and dying.
  • All the worlds spray paint is taken off the shelf in stores.
  • Canvas is made illegal by some government organization.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word.  Use your social media skills to show people this project that might want some fancy canvas hanging up in their home.
  • Don't forget, it's easy to use Indiegogo's share tools located somewhere on this site!
  • You can check out my online store here:  http://canvasbychris.storenvy.com/  - Feel free to order from there if you see something you like.

Let the painting begin.

story:
I'm raising the money to move forward into production. Injection molding, packaging and more materials. I've tried it on another fund raiser, but they don't tell you All the info on how to get better exposure. Check out the video:The Door Bungee: http://youtu.be/LGHVCYXWctI

Help me out. Those little Brown doorstops or wedges seem to grow legs and walk away. I HAVE THE SOLUTION!

You can also attach it to the outside of a camper to hold the door with the use of double sided stick tape. So useful for other applications as well. Check it out. I'm wanting to get them on the store shelves quickly for spring or summer.

Thank you,

Steven Kaufmann

story:
Artists Use Tools to Blow People's Minds.



Hi!  I'm Christopher Butler, illustrator and concept artist (www.chrisbutlerart.com), and for the past several years, I've had the luck of working on a whole bunch of great projects for lots of great people: science fiction and fantasy illustration for publication, concept art for some film and television, a bit of comic book work, and more.  I have a day job with a great company, and at night I come home and keep going...working on more illustration and design.  My favorite part of what I do is that, whether I'm working on my own projects or someone else's, the goal is the same:  I work for that moment when art blows people's minds...if only for a moment. 

Recently...I ran into a series of problems, which might now turn into an opportunity to take my art to the next level and give people more than I have before.  

It started when my Wacom digital tablet broke.  After my computer and my hands, this is the key device that lets me create art.

This was pretty unfortunate..and normally would just be an inconvenience until I ordered myself a new tablet.  However, recent circumstances have made dropping several hundred dollars on a new tablet very difficult.  ( I don't want to dwell on the financial issues.  Suffice it to say I had a medical issue that, while thankfully turned out to be not too serious, has depleted my available "art" budget quite a bit.  I'm not going to miss any meals...but its definitely impacted spending for a while.) 

But now, I think this could be an opportunity to upgrade my resources and a chance start doing some very cool things:  First, I need a new Wacom digital tablet that will let me work.



Wacom Tablets are Magic.

A Wacom Digital Tablet is basically a magical slab of plastic that artists use with a magical pen to draw things on a computer in much the same way we draw on regular paper with a pencil.  (Okay...its probably not actual magic, but it sure feels like it.)  This device is the core of how I work.  


  There is a whole range of Wacom tablets available, but the least pricey/smallest tablet that would allow me to continue on unfettered is the Wacom Intuos Pro Large, which runs about $499 USD.  This is the lowest-tier Wacom tablet that would let me keep working uninterrupted.   


At the upper end of the Wacom Tablet spectrum is the Cintique 24 HD at about $2200 USD.  This would be a life-changing upgrade for an artist like myself.  


So if we manage to hit the goal of $550, fantastic!  Wacom Tablet Achieved!  Beyond that, everything will go toward improving my home studio.  And if we should actually stretch that goal all the way up above $2000...we're getting into Wacom Cintique territory, and that means even faster, better, and more interesting art.


Perks! Perks! Perks!



Honestly...this is going to be the fun part for me.  Because if people are interested in the perks, that means they're interested in my art, and that makes me really, really happy.

Contributors of $1 or more get a huge public thank you.

Contributors of $25 get a very special sticky-note sketch mailed to them.  (Yes, really...trust me, you'll like it.

Contributors of $50 can claim a digital portrait of themselves perfect for profile images on Twitter, Facebook, or wherever you want.

$200 bucks will get a deluxe, high resolution digital illustration. 

Check the details in the "Perks" section for more info.

 

Thanks a bunch!  :)

story:
"It's an artist's job to show people the world they live in.  We hold up mirrors." -- Neil Gaiman

Hi, I'm Julie, and I love to make art!  I am a classically-trained actor, adjunct college professor, and painter.  

As an artist and an educator, I decided long ago that I have two big responsibilities: to share art as a means of therapy for those in need, and to educate myself and others about our diverse world.  

One of the ways I have always intended to accomplish these goals is by participating in an artist residency abroad; studying the culture, creating art inspired by that culture, connecting with local artists as a means of cultural exchange, and then coming home and sharing what I learned.

On my recent winter break, I discovered a residency that will allow me to do all of the above.  The company is called the Arquetopia Foundation, and is located in Puebla, Mexico.  Arquetopia focuses on promoting artistic development through educational programs, with an emphasis on cultural exchange.  They have won awards for providing classical music training for the underserved youth of Puebla, and to learn more about their efforts, you may visit their website here: http://www.archetopia.org.

 I happily applied to Arquetopia, and -- much to my delight -- I am part of the 22% of 329 applicants chosen for residencies this calendar year.  Unfortunately, my income has  decreased this semester (I'm an adjunct professor) and I no longer have the necessary funds to take this incredible opportunity.

Because I believe people have a right to know exactly what they are supporting, let me be fully transparent: $1,600 will go to the remaining balance of the residency, $700 will cover airfare, and the remaining $400 will go towards art supplies and shipping rewards to my wonderful donors. (I am flexible if you'd prefer a reward not mentioned.)

I am going to try my best to attend this residency, but if I cannot, your generosity will go towards a new art collective that Hayley Brotherton, Elizabeth Wallace, Doug Kaylor, and I are creating.  I cannot share too much on our collective yet, but soon we will be able to release our mission statement.  Stay tuned!

Not to be overly confident, but I do have faith that I will have no issues fulfilling the goals of this project and putting your generosity to good use.  I create art regularly -- whether by performing or painting -- in addition to being a responsible teacher.  Being an artist is central to who I am and I am thrilled at the prospect of spending a month abroad discovering, connecting, becoming inspired, and creating.

Thank you so much for viewing my campaign!  If you feel led to do so, please make a contribution and choose a reward.  In making that contribution, you will be supporting my project, Arquetopia's mission of cultural exchange through the arts, and giving a new art collective exposure.  So, whatever the donation, you will be doing a great deal!

Again, many, many thanks!  Feel free to share my campaign and please email me at julieroundtree@gmail.com with any questions.

GO MAKE ART!

story:
A diverse, beautiful place bursting with history and emotion.

A circle of friends loving, and living on an Aegean island.

This is Amorgos, and this is us.

For the past four years talented artists from all over Greece have showcased their creative work, honoring us and our guests with their presence, and bringing life to the island.

Last year we attempted our first crowdfunding campaign and we were overwhelmed by the support we received from the friends of the festival! For the 5th year of the Constellation, we hope we can count again on the help of old and new friends.

All performances take place next to ancient monuments, surrounded by landscapes of rare natural beauty without any complex stage settings.

No one involved in the organization of Asterismos (the Constellation), or any artists, is profiting financially in any way. Everything in this festival is created and offered out of love for the arts and the island.

However,we do need to have a small budget in order to cover the cost of transportation to and within the island, as well as for the accomodations offered to the artists we are hosting.

In order to continue the growth of our small, yet unique, festival we would appreciate your support.

Let's Make It Happen...Again!

Ευχαριστούμε!

Thank you!

story:
Ladies and Gentlemen, Boys and Girls, Children of All Ages...

Over the last decade, Mike James has worked in the trading card industry both as an artist and graphic designer. His work has been included in trading card releases for The Walking Dead, Game of Thrones, The Hobbit, Ghostbusters, and Star Trek to name a few. 

In the late 90's, Mike took to the stage as Mnsr. Stinky Pants touring with the Great Orbax Sideshow. As part of this Canadian menagerie of the bizarre, Mike would contort his body through tennis rackets, smash cans on his hands, consume horrific food-like items in a modern day geek act, and perform some of the lamest card tricks in history.

Putting aside the glamorous world of the circus tent, Mike left the freakshow to focus on family and a career as a graphic artist...But the sawdust never left his veins.

Mike's love of sideshow has remained ever since, and with his first ever independently released trading card set it was obvious what the choice of subject material would be.

...

The Solid Gold Dancers.

...

Market research proved that this would have a very limited fan base and so Mike went with his second choice - The sideshow.

Welcome to the Show - Series 1: Sideshow is a who's who of acclaimed and renowned entertainers working in the sideshow arts today. This set includes true legends of the modern sideshow, Guinness World Record holders, Ripley's: Believe It or Not alumni and some of today's most dangerous daredevils - all in one amazing set.

For his first ever release, Mike is offering an assortment of extremely limited edition cards including hand-signed, memorabilia cards, parallels, inserts, and more.

Hurry! Hurry! Step right up!

Pre-orders for packs of these cards will run through the month of October featuring some amazing incentives that will only be available through this campaign, even including the original art used to create the cards.

Currently, the project has been entirely self-funded by Mike. Not only will contributors receive an incredible product but they will also have the opportunity to support an independent artist in a project that he is passionate about.

The incentives shown here will only be available through this pre-order campaign, with a tentative shipping date of January 2017.

What are the Cards?

There are 20 different sideshow superstars in the set, and the checklist will be completely revealed in the Facebook Group as the campaign continues. Each pack has 5 cards, and every pack includes at least one autographed card, with various parallel versions randomly inserted. The card backs contain biographical and contact information of the respective entertainer. The mystery begins when you buy a pack and see which performers you get!!!

So what are the base cards and inserts, you ask? Every pack will contain a black bordered autographed card and 4 black bordered base cards. As an added bonus, there are a variety of extra cards randomly inserted throughout the product. There are very limited autographed and base cards with red borders, and there will also be extremely rare one-of-a-kind miniature cards as well. 4 special memorabilia cards are also in the works - each will be limited to 100 and will feature pieces of clothing or props actually used on stage at various events.

The Cast of Characters

So who is in the set, you may ask? Here is a partial checklist, with more to be released as the campaign continues...

Dok Haze, Anastasia and Hannibal from the Circus of Horrors, The Great Orbax and Sweet Pepper Klopek from the Monsters of Schlock, Donny Vomit, Bobo's Loco Carneval, Titano Oddfellow, Reggie Bügmüncher, The Space Cowboy and Zoe L'Amore, and Aerial Manx…with more to follow.

What are the Perks?

Spread the Word!

We'll be making daily updates on the Facebook Group announcing our roster and other fun news, facts, videos and more.

Please spread the word and let people know about this incredible one of a kind art project documenting the history of modern sideshow.

Welcome to the Show!
