story:
A Short Summary,

Hi, my name is Ana, some of you may know me as eto-nani. I'm an artist and I particularly enjoy drawing KPOP idols. I started doing Kpop fan art about 2 years ago and honestly since I've started... it's made me the happiest I've been in a long time. I've met so many amazing people that have touched my heart with kindness. I just moved to California and I think this would be the perfect opportunity to expand  with a KCON booth. The problem is since I just moved cross country with little to nothing besides the clothes on my back, it is going to take me a while to get on my feet. I'm going to need your help to make this dream a possibility. Even a dollar will help me get one step closer to making this dream a reality. 

Hello! My name is Sam, Commonly seen as Mixout99. I am an artist, mainly fanart. I love to draw both anime and KPop idols. I enjoy drawing and have been into it for years. To draw Kpop means the world to me. I have truly found happiness from it and made friends who I can relate to. I want to continue growing in my art skills, relationships, and overall enjoyment. To have a booth at Kcon would mean the world. It is a huge opportunity to expand and gain knowledge. It would be a motivation to try harder and to make fans smile more. I want to give others something I made from what I feel with Kpop.

What I Need & What You Get!

Why is $4500.00 our grand total?
  • We are going to need to pay for the booth itself which is $1,000 plus an electricity deposit. They haven't released prices yet so we're just estimating on last year's prices. Since it is 3 days this year it could possibly be more. We are also going to need to purchase things from our online stores (red bubble eto / red bubble mixout/  PAOM) in bulk which will probably run us a good $3,000 easy in just shirts, phone cases, canvases, prints, etc. We will  also need to buy displays, a banner, and stands for the booth.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we will either refund the entirety of the money you donated or you decide if you want to use it for a commission or within our stores. :D 
  • If you do contribute, not only will we be eternally grateful but you will also get perks! 
  • All the people who do donate will get a free mini print of their choice!  

The Impact

Sharing our perspective on this genre to show our support for the idols and fans. Bring each other closer.  We have successfully run small booths at other cons and would like to expand on larger horizons.  

Risks & Challenges

The possibility that we might not even get a booth at Kcon and that we might might not even break even. I do believe that our merch will be unique. We will also try my hardest to make sure that all the merch will affordable and high quality. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand not everyone can help, but if you could get the word out. I'd be very grateful. :D

story:
Hello,

I'm Momo, as all my friends call me. I'm a girl from Germany, who always dreamed of getting my skin tattood by an awesome tattoo artist from London.
Life isn't always that kind to you that you can easily afford such a thing, but maybe life can be as kind as you let it be and maybe there are some kind people out there willing to help me a bit with my plan :)
I already had big struggles in my life and I'm happy to be here =) Some things really helped me trough bad times...like: Harry Potter, art, magic, fairytales, reading, nature and dreaming of England and especially London. It helped me so much, and I feel home when visiting it! So I really want to make a statement to it on my skin some day! I want to start with some flowers and maybe a part of the Marauders Map from Harry Potter and of course it has to be an English tattoo artist! I'm totally in love with her art:
https://instagram.com/kellyviolence/
The problem is that the travel won't be cheap and the tattoo neither :/ so I would need some help on this wish!
Thanks for your time, consideration and help!
Momo
https://www.facebook.com/momo.indigo

I started this campaign to create best professional tips for Tattoo Artists. This book will help you to grow your skill in Tattoo industry. I want to publish this book in many languages, so all Tattoo Artists around the globe can easy understand what book gives you. Tips in the book will be from Pro Artist. 
Book is planed to have 100+ pages with images for better understanding
First edition will be on English language.
Help me to Help Tattoo Community, and this book will help You.

story:
You Should Make A Chess Board!

It's something I hear often as a sculptor of little bronze beasties.  That they would make excellent chess pieces.  And you know what?  They would!  The first time I heard it, I could instantly see what the board might be like.  I even knew the theme and subject of the two sides, but more on that in a bit.

Hello!  I am John Vise and I would like to make a bronze beastie chess board!

I am a New Orleans based artist who makes bronze beasties.  You can see some of my work above, or check out my instagram and website. 

https://www.instagram.com/bronzebeasties/

and

https://www.bronzebeasties.com/

I've been working as a professional artist for about six years now and this is by far the most ambitious project I've attempted.  Mostly because of how I work.   You see, I don't cast my statues, but instead work directly in a fireable media called Bronze Clay.  The end results are bronze, but every piece is sculpted directly in my hands and goes right into a fire.   No wax, no mold, no hassle.

Also, no reproductions.

So if I want to make a chess board, every one of the 32 individual pieces, right down to each pawn, will be a one of a kind work of art.  I keep hoping somebody will commission one,  because the amount of time and money it would take just to start is daunting.  Since that hasn't happened yet.  I'm turning to you! The internets! 

The Board!

So what two sides do I have in mind?   Well, I have many of my little beasties that come out nature oriented.  With vines and trees and mushrooms growing here and there.  I also have some city spirits now and then.  From robots with gears and steam pipes, to impish creatures with whole houses on their heads.  

These shall be the sides!  Forest vs Town!  The Woods vs The City!  Bishops with grand cathedrals or towering trees!  Steam powered knights vs vine covered swamp horses!  It should be so much fun!

As just a sample of what I had in mind, I have made two pawns that you can see above.  Right now they are the same color, but I have a method that should let me color the two sides differently while still being bronze.  I also have a local artist friend who can make me the board itself.  This whole thing already exists, in my head.  I just need your help to get it out of my head and into my hands!

 

Goals!

My first goal is base material costs, which is going to be roughly $500.  I don't want to start till then mostly because I want to sculpt and fire each side of the chessboard together, so that there is consistency in color in the bronze.  (There are always variations, and this will gaurantee the best look)

Perks!

Five levels of perks!

$25 Art Print

An art print based on this project.  I haven't decided what it should be yet.  Either my favorite piece, or pair of pieces, or a shot of the whole board.   Maybe even two people playing on the board.  We shall see what inspiration comes! 

$100 Pawn

You get an actual bronze pawn, crafted at the same time but separately from the main set.  You can choose which side you want, Town or Forest. 

$150 Pick a Piece

Also a handcrafted bronze statue, but this time pick any chess piece you want.   Want me to make you a Queen?  Fancy yourself a Knight?  Any side of the board you want, Woods or City.

$225 Check and Mate (Pick Two Pieces)

Two hand crafted chess pieces, of any combination you want.  Want a pair of Kings?  Or a King and Queen?  Same side of the board, opposite, it's all up to you.   Best value but I'm hoping this funds the project the fastest!

$3000 No, You Make ME That Chess Board!

Do you want the complete project for yourself and only yourself!  Well hot damn, let's get thing done!  Pricing it at $500 what I plan to retail it at. 

So there you have it!  My grand idea!  How about it?  Think I should make a chess board?


See more of my work on Instagram 

https://www.instagram.com/bronzebeasties/

The internets! The Board!So what two sides do I have in mind?   Well, I have many of my little beasties that come out nature oriented.  With vines and trees and mushrooms growing here and there.  I also have some city spirits now and then.  From robots with gears and steam pipes, to impish creatures with whole houses on their heads.  These shall be the sides!  Forest vs Town!  The Woods vs The City!  Bishops with grand cathedrals or towering trees!  Steam powered knights vs vine covered swamp horses!  It should be so much fun!As just a sample of what I had in mind, I have made two pawns that you can see above.  Right now they are the same color, but I have a method that should let me color the two sides differently while still being bronze.  I also have a local artist friend who can make me the board itself.  This whole thing already exists, in my head.  I just need your help to get it out of my head and into my hands! Goals!My first goal is base material costs, which is going to be roughly $500.  I don't want to start till then mostly because I want to sculpt and fire each side of the chessboard together, so that there is consistency in color in the bronze.  (There are always variations, and this will gaurantee the best look)Perks!Five levels of perks!$25 Art PrintAn art print based on this project.  I haven't decided what it should be yet.  Either my favorite piece, or pair of pieces, or a shot of the whole board.   Maybe even two people playing on the board.  We shall see what inspiration comes! $100 PawnYou get an actual bronze pawn, crafted at the same time but separately from the main set.  You can choose which side you want, Town or Forest. $150 Pick a PieceAlso a handcrafted bronze statue, but this time pick any chess piece you want.   Want me to make you a Queen?  Fancy yourself a Knight?  Any side of the board you want, Woods or City.$225 Check and Mate (Pick Two Pieces)Two hand crafted chess pieces, of any combination you want.  Want a pair of Kings?  Or a King and Queen?  Same side of the board, opposite, it's all up to you.   Best value but I'm hoping this funds the project the fastest!$3000 No, You Make ME That Chess Board!Do you want the complete project for yourself and only yourself!  Well hot damn, let's get thing done!  Pricing it at $500 what I plan to retail it at. So there you have it!  My grand idea!  How about it?  Think I should make a chess board?See more of my work on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/bronzebeasties/

story:
Short Summary

Unseen, Unheard: Artist in Chicago is a collaborative article where I look to discover new and upcoming artist with-in the city of Chicago. I want to research, follow, and tell true inspiring stories about these artist in the best way possible.

What We Need & What You Get

Asking to raise a total of $900 that will go towards the following:

  • Equipment
  • Travel
  • Meals (for the Artist and Crew)
  • Ability to pay my small crew
  • Submission fees to get the article into the right hands.
With your contribution come a few Perks:
  • $5: Gets you a shout out in the "Thank You" section of the article!
  • $10: Gets you a hand written vintage post card signed by ME! (along with the shout out)
  • $50: 2 small gifts from the featured artist/the postcard/ the shout out!
The more funds raised mean more PERKS! So sit tight and more will come your way for contributing to this project!
The Impact

The Artistic aspect of Chicago is mind blowing! With your help I can bring new and exciting artist into the forefront. No art form is off the table; Music/Theater/Visual/Fashion  you name it, if it's out there I want to be able to share their stories with this city.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by sharing this link via: FaceBook, Twitter or any other social media platform you  might have! Any and ALL contributions are welcomed!

story:
Short Summary

We've decided to organize an event to showcase creations from an underrepresented perspective in Santa Barbara.

What We Need & What You Get

Luckily, we don't need much to launch our first event, however there are a few small costs that we need help with.

BUDGET:

  • $100 - Cost of Venue Rental 
  • $100 - Flyer Printing 
  • $300 - Cost of Materials (this is cost at the most modest scale)
TOTAL BUDGET $500

The Impact

You support will help re-energize the Santa Barbara art scene. Girl On Girl is just the beginning! The date is confirmed and the space is booked, all we need is a little help from you (every little bit helps) !

Risks & Challenges

There is nothing to lose with your contribution. Everyone comes out a winner and the show will go on!
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't financially contribute, that's ok....we understand. You can however help by doing the following

  • Please share information on our campaign. 
  • Share my artist website: www.simonewilde.com
  • Put potential contributors directly in touch with Simone - hi@simonewilde.com
  • Attend the "Girl On Girl" event! Admission is FREE!

Thanks!

story:
SPELLBINDERS INTERNATIONAL FESTIVAL OF MAGIC WAS CREATED TO INSPIRE ARTS AND EDUCATION.

Last year, world class magicians drew over 3000 people into local libraries and the Performing Arts Center, and it was all FREE. We need your help to make the magic happen again this year.

CLAIM YOUR PERKS FOR DONATING TODAY, INCLUDING ONCE IN A LIFETIME EXPERIENCES!

The Ultimate David Copperfield Experience, Lunch with Lance Burton, Consult with Rick Marcelli, Magic Castle dinner with Michael Finney, Golf with Fielding West, as well as these cool collectible Limited Edition Posters, Mugs, and T-Shirts.

You can even get into the World's Greatest Insider Magic Event, this October: the Thin Air Summit, featuring Lennart Green, Shoot Ogawa, Richard Turner, Bob Sheets, Stephen Bargatze, Martin Lewis, Rob Zabrecky, James Dimmare, Christopher Hart, Kyle & Mistie Knight, Jade and Larry Wilson. We're adding more perks all the time, so come back often. Scroll down to check out the perks on this page that were too weird to mention upfront!


LIMITED EDITION SPELLBINDERS GLOW IN THE DARK POSTER

OFFICIAL SPELLBINDERS T-SHIRT (Front)

OFFICIAL SPELLBINDERS T-SHIRT (Back)

SPELLBINDERS COFFEE MUG


F.A.Q.


Q: When do I get my perks?

A: All perks will be sent within 6 - 8 weeks after the campaign ends.


Q: Will I get my perks in time to give as Xmas gifts?

A:  Maybe.  Our goal is to have every one of them in your hot little hands by Dec. 15th at the latest.


Q: What about perks that happen during SPELLBINDERS, or the Thin Air Summit, like private lessons with badass magicians?

A: We’ll have your name and perk detailed on our secure servers and confirm them with you before you arrive.


Q: What about my tickets to the Gala Show?

A: You’ll receive those by mail by Oct. 20, 2015, or, if the gods of technology interfere, we’ll have them for you at the Will Call box-office window at the Pioneer Center on the day of the show.


Q: Is my donation tax-deductible?

A: Education Renaissance of Nevada Initiative is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization.  All donations are tax-deductible to the fullest extent allowed by law.  You should consult with your C.P.A. or tax preparer.  Tax ID: 46-1195169.  (A list of the fair market value of each perk can be requested by e-mail from info@thinairsummit.info.)


Q: What about my t-shirt?  How do I make sure I get the right size?

A:  We’ll be contacting you to find out your exact size by November 1st (and we’ll even include a sizing chart so you can be sure of getting exactly what you want.)


Q:  Is travel and hotel included in my Thin Air Summit or Thin Air Summit VIP perk?

A:  No, ‘fraid not.  (This is a fundraiser, after all.)  However, the Peppermill Resort Spa Casino was kind enough to arrange these screaming deals for Thin Air Summit folks-- Click here or call 800 282 2444 and refer to group code:  CERNV15.  (But, they’re limited in number so quit fooling around and make your reservation RIGHT NOW.)


Q:  What about my lunch with Lance Burton in Las Vegas or Julie McCullough at the Magic Castle in Hollywood?  Are you flying me out?

A:  No.  None of the perks include travel or accommodations.  Isn’t it enough that these cool people are making themselves available for you?  Now you just have to get there to experience the awesomeness.  If that means a crazy road trip where your car breaks down in the middle of nowhere and you have to hitchhike and you get picked up by a Scary Stranger who turns out to be the love of your life and you live happily ever after and never even make it to redeem your perk-- you’re welcome.  If, on the other hand, the Scary Stranger chops you up like salami, you can rest assured that Matt Damon will probably play you in the inevitable movie version that will follow.  (And in the film you probably get rescued at the last minute and still make it to the assigned perk where you meet the celeb who will probably be played by Scarlett Johansson.)


Q: So can I order anything on the menu for lunch or dinner?

A:  Yes, with the exception of booze.  Our non-profit can’t pay for any purchases of alcohol.  (Look on the bright side-- you’ll be the Designated Driver.)


Q:  I’m confused about this Brain Stimulator.  Will it actually make me smarter?

A:  Hard to say.  Kind of depends on how smart you are now.  Would you be interested in some magic beans?  Now those babies really work.

BRAIN STIMULATOR

story:
I'm very excited to announce that I will be traveling to New York City  to perform at the Lincoln Center's Out of Doors August 1st, and 2nd. This opportunity is indeed a blessing. Early last spring I was contacted because of my poem that was featured on Button Poetry "Love You Some Indians," and then on Indian Country Today Media Network. I was invited to perform my poem and others at this event. My anticipation and excitement is beyond the words I can express. So I humbly ask for your assistance on my journey.

Traveling is always a great experience, and even more when you have a community behind you. The expenses that I do need to be covered for this trip would be transportation, food, and other.

I have never been to New York, and I am told it is a whole other world. So anything that you are will to help me with for this great experience I would be very happy and grateful. In return for your contribution I will be happy to send you a Postcard from New York. Thank you.

Thank you.

story:
In 2010, my life partner of 31 years, Caroline Scott, a painter, was diagnosed with amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS). By 2014 her illness progressed rapidly and she required around the clock care. As a painter myself, I would care for her in the early morning until the nurses aid would come and take care of her until I got home from work. During the period before her death, exhausted and grieving, I fell two months behind in the rent due to both mine and Caroline’s medical and credit cards bills. By the third month I received an eviction notice. I went to housing court and worked out a payment plan with the landlord. I was paying $3,619.90 rent, plus $895.00 a month to cover the arrears. After selling a painting, I was able to make the payments for the next 8 months, but by April 2015, with medical bills piling up, I fell behind again.

Caroline passed away August 14, 2014. Still grieving, I also have my own medical condition that I have been managing for many years. I have Hepatitis C. My prescription treatment is a 90 day supply of Harvoni which is $94,000. Thankfully, my medical insurance covers 95%, but I’m still required to cover a $3,000 copay and another $1,000 for each following month. With all the medical bills and debts collecting, I began to search for assistance. I applied to several companies that give grants for Hepatitis C patients, but my applications were denied because my income is too high. Without considering my income versus the bills I have to pay for myself along with the outstanding debt from my late partner, I am left with few options.

Today, I’m still searching for assistance and support to cover my rental arrears and which amounts to $16,500, which is due by September 10.

About Helmut Krackie:

Being bored with my figure-drawing class at SVA, a subconscious force prompted me to go out to the nearest hardware store and purchase masking tape and spray paint. I created my first “layers” painting that day in the style which I currently work, and I am no longer bored (with anything!). I paint with tape. Tape is the vehicle which allows me to express myself with color and movement. Often the final top surface is taken down to layers below by sanding and scratching. This is where the character of the painting is built--revealing the intertwining, unwinding textural layers underneath. I alternate painted acrylic layers with tape placed in strategic areas, sometimes up to 12 layers on a piece. Every color represents a layer of color until the final reveal when all the tape is removed. Although the fluidity of the pieces may appear to be random, they are planned, with the flow of color depending on my emotions. Nothing is airbrushed, and upon closer inspection, one is able to see and feel the complex and emotional intensity that each layer reveals.

My paintings are on wood or canvas containing abstract, linear, or graphic layers still using tape, but brush applied acrylic. I derive inspiration from sound whether musically or ambient mixed with movement from the wind. A notable influence is Brice Marden. I have been exhibiting my art since 1998, and live and work in New York City.

story:
Stuffies for Syria- help us help the kids!

We are two grade 4 students and we need your help.

  • Did you know over 2 million Syrian kids have had to leave their country? 
  • Did you know many of them have no home, no extra clothes, no school now? 
  • Have you ever been so scared you couldn't sleep or eat? 

We know that when you have a stuffie you don't feel as scared- so we would like to collect as many stuffies as we can from people in our community and from our friends to send to neighbouring countries to Syria where the refugee kids are headed. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise funds to ship the boxes of stuffies. 

  • Every penny you give us will go to shipping the stuffies and anything extra we will give to organizations helping refugees in Europe
  • We can't give you anything in return except for gratitude. Thank you for making an impact! 

The Impact

Your contribution will truly make a HUGE difference for these kids who right now are scared and alone and have no toys. Thank you for helping!

story:
Intro Collection: Rubber Dolly - photogravure, In The End - mixed media, Hadrian - Watermedia, and Summer Feet - Monotype

Briefly

Always, art has been been part of my life in some form or another, and while it was discouraged in my younger years, I have never given up my desires. In recent years I took an active role in fulfilling my dreams. In the beginning, I taught art, mostly volunteering my time (K-12 and adults). I also worked for a longer period as a freelance designer for crafting publications and manufacturers. After I gained confidence and skills, I evolved into fine arts. I returned to college taking extensive art classes in various subjects, primarily drawing and printmaking, but also in pottery and 35 film. I have maintained a high average, surpassed class criteria, accepted into Phi Theta Kappa, and continuously participated in various competitions, independent studio classes, the 2013 Italian workshop at LaRomita, and continued volunteer work.  My work is varied in details of redemption, surviving child abuse and molestation to large scale, in your face explorations of life and family.

                                  "Confidential" Seadragon Submarine 31' x 7'

Details

This Fall, I desire to return to the Italian Intensive workshop to continue studies and learn new techniques.  The course is $ 3800 (includes room and board), plus I will have round-trip airline, travel expenses, excursions, and supplies to pay for.  I also have tuition, books, and supplies to complete these 3 Sophomore level classes to continue on at University of North Texas.

If I reach a majority of my funds, I will be able to attend LaRomita, but if not, I should have enough to at least complete the college classes planned.  Any leftover funds (I can be frugal!) will be applied specifically to the Spring Semester at UNT.

Impact 

Recently, I salvaged an old historic farmhouse (scheduled to be condemned) and completed the restoration to be used to promote local arts. We have the choice of selling this farmhouse to developers moving into the area (tear down for new development) in order to continue my education or keep my dream of helping local artist, finding resources to continue my education elsewhere, such as crowd-funding.

                                                       


My work and my education is important to not only produce quality work, but I believe my work is a form of sharing about my life experiences, primarily child abuse issues, so that other are more aware and better informed.

Risks & Challenges 

My pieces have evolved from individual pieces to a number of series showcasing my skills and serving as a voice to my beliefs, concerns, and even the story of my life.  I am currently working on a number of series, two of which are focused on child abuse, primarily molestation. 

It is a difficult approach, as it is too personal and requires a lot of focus and emotional balance.  While I alternate with pieces reflecting my family focus, I really desire to reach those who seem immune to the reality and alarming statistics of children being abused.  I continuously explore various mediums, techniques, and new processes to not only address these issues, but find a visual expression that will attract the eye, in spite of the content. 

               


You Can Help

Not everyone can help financially, but I really appreciate the emotional support and encouragement.  If you would please pass this campaign on to others who not only appreciate the arts, but value education, and have a concern about the social issues of child abuse.  If you need extra help in sharing, Indeigogo has share tools to help spread the word.  www.kennabolesprior.com
story_txt:
Intro Collection: Rubber Dolly - photogravure, In The End - mixed media, Hadrian - Watermedia, and Summer Feet - Monotype
BrieflyAlways, art has been been part of my life in some form or another, and while it was discouraged in my younger years, I have never given up my desires. In recent years I took an active role in fulfilling my dreams. In the beginning, I taught art, mostly volunteering my time (K-12 and adults). I also worked for a longer period as a freelance designer for crafting publications and manufacturers. After I gained confidence and skills, I evolved into fine arts. I returned to college taking extensive art classes in various subjects, primarily drawing and printmaking, but also in pottery and 35 film. I have maintained a high average, surpassed class criteria, accepted into Phi Theta Kappa, and continuously participated in various competitions, independent studio classes, the 2013 Italian workshop at LaRomita, and continued volunteer work.  My work is varied in details of redemption, surviving child abuse and molestation to large scale, in your face explorations of life and family.                                  "Confidential" Seadragon Submarine 31' x 7'

DetailsThis
	Fall, I desire to return to the Italian Intensive workshop to
	continue studies and learn new techniques.  The course is $
	3800 (includes room and board), plus I will have round-trip airline,
	travel expenses, excursions, and supplies to pay for.  I also
	have tuition, books, and supplies to complete these 3 Sophomore
	level classes to continue on at University of North Texas.If
	I reach a majority of my funds, I will be able to attend LaRomita,
	but if not, I should have enough to at least complete the college
	classes planned.  Any leftover funds (I can be frugal!) will be
	applied specifically to the Spring Semester at UNT.

Impact Recently, I salvaged an old historic farmhouse (scheduled to be condemned) and completed the restoration to be used to promote local arts. We have the choice of selling this farmhouse to developers moving into the area (tear down for new development) in order to continue my education or keep my dream of helping local artist, finding resources to continue my education elsewhere, such as crowd-funding.                                                       My
	work and my education is important to not only produce quality work,
	but I believe my work is a form of sharing about my life
	experiences, primarily child abuse issues, so that other are more
	aware and better informed.

Risks
& Challenges 
My pieces have evolved from individual pieces to a number of series showcasing my skills and serving as a voice to my beliefs, concerns, and even the story of my life.  I am currently working on a number of series, two of which are focused on child abuse, primarily molestation. 
It is a difficult approach, as it is too personal and requires a lot of focus and emotional balance.  While I alternate with pieces reflecting my family focus, I really desire to reach those who seem immune to the reality and alarming statistics of children being abused.  I continuously explore various mediums, techniques, and new processes to not only address these issues, but find a visual expression that will attract the eye, in spite of the content. 

               

You Can Help
Not everyone can help financially, but I really appreciate the emotional support and encouragement.  If you would please pass this campaign on to others who not only appreciate the arts, but value education, and have a concern about the social issues of child abuse.  If you need extra help in sharing, Indeigogo has share tools to help spread the word.  www.kennabolesprior.com

story:
Om Om Om

Hello everyone!
Thank you for taking the time to read this. My name is Ganga, other wise known as Jasmin. In this lifetime this mind had struggled with depression, anxiety, and confusion on how to express itself in a positive way. What has helped and continues to help me grow is my Yoga practice. Yoga is a science that helped me see a healthier way of living; Healthier for my body, mind, and soul. 

This is why I have chosen to create Yogic children's books. To share this beautiful science and way of living with younger generations so they could perhaps bypass this confusion and live in harmony with all of existence. This coloring book is the first of many to help introduce basic Yogic principles for Love, Self Awareness, Non-Violence, Honesty,etc. In this coloring book children will have the opportunity to learn about Shapes, Colors, Chakras, Asanas (Physical Yoga Postures), and so much more.

Why do we need $1000 right now? The Printing of Shapes and Chakras cost $1000 and we're hoping to have them printed and ready to be sold at upcoming Benefits. Every penny earned will be going towards this. Shapes and Chakras Coloring Book will be printed!


Helping publish this coloring book will not only help benefit the children but will help raise funds and awareness for Puresa Humanitarian. Puresa is helping rescue girls and women from brothels and giving them a place to stay. Why are funds needed desperately right now?  Puresa owns a piece of land that they intend to build a permanent home for the girls. The Indian Government is threatening to re-claim the land if building does not commence by this summer. They already have grants from the Indian Ministry of Education to run an elementary through college level school under that permanent structure.This is a huge deal as the girls are shunned from society and not afforded an education, even though they were so brutally victimized. They of course will have emotional, spiritual and health counseling, skills training for jobs, sustainable gardening and more.

So they need our HELP.

A portion of the funds made by the coloring book will also be going towards my son's (River) schooling tuition. 

Every penny is used for the spreading of Education, Awareness, and Love


These coloring books will be sold on Etsy, in Yoga studios, and at Seeds Of Service upcoming Benefit for Puresa. If anyone has interest in providing another space to sell this creation or any questions regarding any of the information shared here  please feel free to contact me at Jasmin.Barrios@gmail.com

Feel free to share this on any social media you like.

Thank you for taking the time to read this <3

May all living beings benefit from this creation, especially those suffering.

Love, Serve, Remember

Ganga/Jasmin

story:
Short Summary

My name is Graham Sheen and I am a Northamptonshire based artist who creates unique works of art out of some of the most unlikely things. See www.sheenart.co.uk for more information on current artwork. I currently have artwork in Ripley's Believe it or Not entitle Pinsanity, which was made using over 27,600 map pins.

I am holding my first art exhibition at The Rooftop Gallery in Corby throughout November 2015 and through this exhibition I am looking to raise money for The Roy Castle Lung Cancer Foundation which supported my Grandfather up until he passed away in May 2014.

Any event has costs in order to be set up and in order to raise as much as possible for this worthy cause I am hoping that Crowdfunding this exhibit will be a good way to cover some of these costs.


What We Need & What You Get In Return

In order to fund the Something Different Exhibition successfully I require a total of £900 and the budget is broken down as follows:

- £340 for the gallery rental fee

- £260 for food, drink and hired assistance on the opening night reception on 2nd November 2015

- £200 for marketing and advertising

- £100 for additional cost, materials, wall hanging supplies, tags, labels.

If you donate to my campaign you will receive the following perks:

  • £2 - I will put your name in the thanks section of the exhibition program
  • £5 = your name in the thanks section of the program and an invite to the opening night / private view (food included).
  • £12 = Half page advert in the program, thanks in program and invite to the opening night / private viewing (food included)
  • £65 personalised 9" x 9" portrait, thanks in program and invite for 2 to the opening night.
  • £150 = Personalised 18" x 22" portrait, thanks in program and invite for 2 to the opening night.
  • £250 = Personalised 28" x 36" portrait, thanks in program and invite for 4 to the opening night (4 available)

The Impact your donation will make

 

All donations will go towards the set up of the exhibition, advertising and ultimately will contribute towards raising funds for The Roy Castle Lung Cancer Foundation and the people it provides for.

 
 


 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Even if you can't donate then you can still help by sharing details on the exhibition using the links below:

www.sheenart.co.uk

https://www.facebook.com/grahamsheenart

http://us10.campaign-archive2.com/?u=4cefbfe9907fb44b99f8fb9b2&id=6bada190d5

 

And that's all there is to it.

If you have any questions then please contact me through www.sheenart.co.uk or email sheengraham@rocketmail.com


Many thanks

story:
John Macaluso presents the Crowdfunding campaign :
" Guy Ferrer is the artist and creator of the Public Art Bronze Sculpture T.O.L.E.R.A.N.C.E. This monument has been installed in three permanent locations.

Now involved as the Team Leader supporting the artist, we have assembled an impressive network of benefactors and donors, and additional potential sites for T.O.L.E.R.A.N.C.E. in the US and around the world.

We are working towards our goal and vision of installing T.O.L.E.R.A.N.C.E in a "necklace" circling the planet - pinpoints of light as Tributes to Peace - against the darkness of intolerance and terrorism that we are facing around the world.
Our plan is to establish each location of T.O.L.E.R.A.N.C.E as a focus, inspiring other artists, students and entire communities to join us in this "First Step of the Journey".

Now, I am offering You the opportunity to join us and participate in our $ 975,000 project.
We are offering some very exciting rewards to our contributors, ranging from personally signed momentos, paintings and bronze sculptures by Guy Ferrer, to hosting your visit to Southern France to meet Guy, tour his studio and foundry, and experience a wonderful cultural adventure in the South of France.

Any donation you can make is appreciated, either as a "Lead Donor" or a supporting contributor.
Together we can make this happen and you can participate in our Tribute to Peace. "

-------------

Below is a link where you can add your email, and we will keep you updated of new developments and our progress.  

Yes, please keep me informed of your progress and new developments.

Your email: Click here


-------------


" World traveler, Guy Ferrer draws from his many stays of work abroad the human matter which animates his work and inspires its spirit. Impassioned by the spiritualities of the world, he offers to us with power his sensitive and poetic vision of Man tightened by Time and facing his paradoxical destiny :  Man is, according to Ferrer, both of light and mud, and one's pathway of life is an initiation. "

Victoria Conti, 2009 

Guy FERRER (1955) is French of Mediterranean origin. He has mainly worked in Paris, in Los Angeles and in several foreign countries in the context of creating temporary studios as New York, Caracas, Lima, Beijing, Johannesburg...

In 2012, the installation of his art studios in French Catalonia marked his return to the Mediterranean. His work, mainly dedicated to sculpture and painting, also explores writing and architecture. Its line of force and main themes are spirituality and the place of Man facing Time. 

Since the 1980s, Guy Ferrer has developed an international career highlighted by exhibitions in numerous museums and galleries.

Several French Departments and Agencies have recognized the artist: a monumental bronze sculpture for the French embassy in Singapore, a large fresco painted for the French embassy in Bakou (Azerbaijan), sculpture for the French Foreign Affairs central building in Paris. 

The O.E.C.D commissioned and permanently displays the large triptych titled “Liberté-Egalité-Fraternité”.

Artistic partnerships have been developed with several companies,  such as Lefranc&Bourgeois, Le Bon Marché, Champagne Nicolas Feuillatte, Champagne Jacquart, Bordeaux vineyards... 

What the artist says :

" The commitment of a lifetime : create, live to create, in the constancy of the renewal, it is exactly what art represents for me - a total commitment and a testimony. Thanks to all the explorations that art allows, I improvise my research, "self-taught" as they say, as if there were any way to do otherwise ! The history of art has opened many paths but has mined them as well !

We must negotiate with the material, give to receive. It is a subtle relationship, harmony is capricious and when it comes, it is still a surprise. What a joy to find sometimes the correct answers to all questions aesthetic and formal. And especially in the question of the meaning of what you are doing. From time to time one finds, but always temporarily. Because what always comes back, and with such a force, the requirement of the path where each completed work barely commands relentlessly to go forward with another work which could be sharper, where exist other possible responses. One must remain open, available as a cup, with open heart and senses. There is always a teaching to receive, either on a artistic level or on the nature of the world. Art is a magical source of knowledge and intuitions. Some secrets whispered from the other side of the visible, as granted by the Great Mystery.

Practicing, working, this is surely the best way to grow a little, share with others, hear a breath of meaning, color the existence, and sweep the vain controversies on the beauty and harmony, eternal forces.

One has to tend his heart and his senses to hear any teaching that might be brought, either on an artistic issue or on the nature of the world. "

Baku (Azerbaijan), June 20, 2000

Our goal of $975,000, along with other private and public donations,  will allow us to place T.O.L.E.R.A.N.C.E in the United States, spreading its message of A TRIBUTE TO PEACE. If we exceed our Indiegogo target, we can continue working towards our ultimate goal of placing T.O.L.E.RA.N.C.E in other important and strategic locations around the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:  Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Sprout Festival 2019 Merchandise Fundraiser 

Sprout Festival is a 3 day Music, Arts and Educational Festival hosted at Woodleigh Station in Ravenshoe. 

Our vision is sustainability and the positive social impacts events can have for attendees and their ability to facilitate pro environmental change. 

In the festivals 2nd  year, we successfully eradicated 300m2 of the invasive plant species Lantana and replanted over 300 native species along the Herbert River Catchment. 

This project aids in reducing fine sediment run-off to the Great Barrier Reef and will help improve water quality in the Herbert River catchment. 

(Sediment is one of the major materials affecting the health of the Great Barrier Reef. Fine sediment poses the highest risk to reef ecosystems, smothering corals, seagrasses and other plants, affecting their growth and survival)

In addition to this, the festival hosted 3 days of music and education, facilitated by our workshop space, which was running for three days entirely off renewable energy.

The event from all aspects except financially was a major success. We ended up with quite a large deficit so we thought that we would reach out to our amazing community to help recuperate some of the loss. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order for you all to get Seedy! We will be doing a run of limited edition T- Shirts and Lanyards.

Those who support us by buying T-Shirts will be placed on a unique mailing list to be given the chance to secure a Sprout Festival Supporters Ticket before tickets go on sale for Sprout 2020. 

These shirts will be printed by Local Cairns business, Shirtbox, whose whole business is run completely from Solar Power, and that have a high level of Corporate Social Responsibility. See here for more info >> https://shirtbox.com.au/corporate-environmental...

Smaller contributions will also be made available to help fund our revegetation projects, and you can help us plant trees for the future by funding of planting a tree at Sprout Festival 2020. 

If you can't contribute monetarily - that's okay! Please share our project by the link on social media, and like/comment/share all our future posts on Facebook.

story:
Hello! 

After a great show at the Saatchi Gallery in March with the UK Crafts Council, my latest thing I've made (燒烤設置 (Barbecue setting)) has been invited to be part of some prestigious events including:

  •  The 2019 British Ceramics Biennial  
  • Parcours Ceramique Carougeois 2019 Biennial in Geneva with Taste Contemporary.
  • A residency at the Shanghai Academy of Fine Art where I'll be making more of this                                 stuff
  • The Yangtze River Delta Cultural Industry Exhibition (Shanghai)

I'm super excited about these opportunities, but unfortunately getting 燒烤設置 to these places and in front of key people is expensive! So, I need your help. Become a part of this global project with me right from the outset. 

Check out the perks and packages to the right for each donation amount (click on them for more info and what they include), and help 燒烤設置 (Barbecue setting) travel around the world!

Thank you!!!!!!!!!

What am I going to do with the money?

2 very important things:

  • With your generous contributions, these funds will help me to cover the basic logistics of travel and shipping as well as pay my collaborators who will be helping me to film and edit the commercial and infomercial aspects of the marketing campaign I am developing.
  • Your help will also assist in a very important endeavor: arts funding. I've applied to some funding bodies but they require match funding for applications to be successful. If I can raise just 10% of the overall costs, this will greatly increase my chances of getting major arts funding. This happening will not only make it possible to create more work and experiment with new ideas, it will further my career and help me to get more support for projects like this in the future!

What’s 燒烤設置 all about?

Well, 燒烤設置, is a collection of American backyard BBQ items made out of blue and white porcelain. It's a reflection on the historic relationship between the East and West which was at first based on the trade of Chinese porcelain, and has been credited for initiating the current global economy. 燒烤設置 highlights the way the tables are turning right now between China and the West by packaging an aspect of Western culture that can be seen as both low-brow and the soul of America (the backyard BBQ), for a hypothetical Chinese client. Originally inspired by misprints on historic Chinese export porcelain, the pieces included in BBQ all have poorly google-translated silly backyard BBQ sayings on them like "you don't make friends with salad", "I don't get drunk I get awesome", and "my grill, my rules". 燒烤設置 explores themes relating to miscommunications in design, the commoditization of culture, China’s soft power initiatives, and it’s new position as a leader in the global consumer market.To learn more, and see more pics,  visit: https://www.maryomalley.co.uk/barbecue-setting

Alongside these exciting exhibition opportunities, I am also developing a brand new satirical marketing campaign for 燒烤設置 which will include a commercial, informercial, and merchandise (similar to what you'll receive when you donate)! I don't know about you, but I am particularly excited about this, because it's a brand new way to explore ways of creating and collaborating with other people as well as expanding on what 燒烤設置 has to say. Also, it will all be hilarious.

 

 

Last but not least, who am I you ask?

For those of you who don’t know me, here’s a little bit about who I am and things I’ve done:

Link to CV

I am a professional ceramic artist and having been working full time as such for the past 7 years. I received a BFA from the University of the Arts in Philadelphia in 2007 and an MA from the Royal College of Art in 2016. 

I use the inherent anthropological qualities of clay and my experiences with clay and cultures around the world to discuss subjects related to economic, psychological, and socio-political issues. These narratives often link to historical precedence, and are reflections on our status quo.

I graduated from the Royal College of Art in 2016 with an MA in Ceramics and Glass. I’ve been invited to participate in group and solo exhibitions in the U.S., U.K., E.U., China, and India, and have worked with galleries in London, the U.S., and E.U. My work has been shown at Art Miami, Art Market Hamptons, Art New York, Christie’s, the Saatchi Gallery, The Museum of Contemporary Design and Applied Arts in Switzerland, the Islip Art Museum in New York, American Craft Council (ACC) Shows, The Philadelphia Museum of Art Craft Show, and The Clay Studio. It’s been acquired by the 21C Museum Hotel Group, The JingDeZhen Ceramic Institute Museum, the Waskowmium Collection, and the Shanghai Academy of Fine Art, and received two Awards of Excellence from the ACC. Its been featured in magazines in China as well as Ceramics Monthly, Ceramic Review, the Huffington Post, Colossal, the N.E.A. Artworks Blog, and Crafts magazine.

I am a co-founder of Collective Matter. Together we ran an extensive 6 month Tate Exchange Residency project, successfully crowdfunded to build a South London based ceramics studio and residency program with Turner Prize winning architects Assemble, and are currently managing a project with socially engaged artists at our satellite space, The Potting Shed.

story_txt:
Hello! After a great show at the Saatchi Gallery in March with the UK Crafts Council, my latest thing I've made (燒烤設置 (Barbecue setting)) has been invited to be part of some prestigious events including:
 The 2019 British Ceramics Biennial  
Parcours Ceramique Carougeois 2019 Biennial in Geneva with Taste Contemporary.
A residency at the Shanghai Academy of Fine Art where I'll be making more of this                                 stuff
The Yangtze River Delta Cultural Industry Exhibition (Shanghai)
I'm super excited about these opportunities, but unfortunately getting 燒烤設置 to these places and in front of key people is expensive! So, I need your help. Become a part of this global project with me right from the outset. Check out the perks and packages to the right for each donation amount (click on them for more info and what they include), and help 燒烤設置 (Barbecue setting) travel around the world!Thank you!!!!!!!!!What am I going to do with the money?2 very important things:
With your generous contributions, these funds will help me to cover the basic logistics of travel and shipping as well as pay my collaborators who will be helping me to film and edit the commercial and infomercial aspects of the marketing campaign I am developing.
Your help will also assist in a very important endeavor: arts funding. I've applied to some funding bodies but they require match funding for applications to be successful. If I can raise just 10% of the overall costs, this will greatly increase my chances of getting major arts funding. This happening will not only make it possible to create more work and experiment with new ideas, it will further my career and help me to get more support for projects like this in the future!
What’s 燒烤設置 all about?Well, 燒烤設置, is a collection of American backyard BBQ items made out of blue and white porcelain. It's a reflection on the historic relationship between the East and West which was at first based on the trade of Chinese porcelain, and has been credited for initiating the current global economy. 燒烤設置 highlights the way the tables are turning right now between China and the West by packaging an aspect of Western culture that can be seen as both low-brow and the soul of America (the backyard BBQ), for a hypothetical Chinese client. My work has been shown at Art Miami, Art Market Hamptons, Art New York, Christie’s, the Saatchi Gallery, The Museum of Contemporary Design and Applied Arts in Switzerland, the Islip Art Museum in New York, American Craft Council (ACC) Shows, The Philadelphia Museum of Art Craft Show, and The Clay Studio. It’s been acquired by the 21C Museum Hotel Group, The JingDeZhen Ceramic Institute Museum, the Waskowmium Collection, and the Shanghai Academy of Fine Art, and received two Awards of Excellence from the ACC. Its been featured in magazines in China as well as Ceramics Monthly, Ceramic Review, the Huffington Post, Colossal, the N.E.A. Artworks Blog, and Crafts magazine.I am a co-founder of Collective Matter. story:
What It's About

*DISCLAIMER* This deck isn't for everyone, although it absolutely should be. Be it stated that the guide book does include adult language and themes that may not be suitable for young humans or people who aren't quite ready to dismantle misogynistic and colonist behaviors in our communities just yet.

Themes you'll encounter in the book:

Personal growth, homophobia, trans rights, learning, toxic masculinity, boundaries, environmentalism, fat phobia, renewable resources, self-care, protest, projected self image, symbiosis, challenging authority, conscious consumerism and much more!

How to use the deck:

This deck is designed to give you nuggets of advice with the intention of improving your life and those around you, inspired by nature's wisdom.

  • Pull one card in the morning for a daily wake up call.
  • When things start seeming entirely overwhelming and you can't imagine how they'll ever change for the better, pull a card to gain some perspective.
  • If someone you know is being a bad friend, have them pull a card. *Be sure to rig the deck so that they get the Fly. It will be the advice they need to hear.
  • Anonymously gift a deck to your shitty boss in hopes that it makes them a better person.
  • Leave a deck in a public place as an offering to whoever finds it. If you believe in things like "the universe," then the right person will stumble on it exactly when they need it the most.
     

About the Artist

Conjured by creative powerhouse, Cuellar, these babies are individually conceived as hand-drawn, carved and printed linocuts before they are vectorized and screen printed by fellow artist Hans Perez all right here in San Diego. The purpose of this campaign is to get the production side of things movin' & groovin'; your contribution will cover supplies, studio time, and maintaining an almost unimaginable level of artistic badassery.

 

Risks & Challenges

Good News: this is essentially risk free. If you contribute, you are guaranteed to receive product. You want a deck? You got it! If we exceed our expectations for this campaign we will only be able to improve future products. 

More Shit You Might Like

If you like what you see, you can get the full scoop on the deck and check out some other dope art at kristacuellar.com or find it on Instagram @irreverentoracledeck.

story:
Unlocked Figures

 

About this PROJECT

關於這個項目

 

We are the team of Journey to the Sweet(JTS), now we are making the ART TOYs, KIMOCHU Chocolate Series, which were successfully crowdfunded before!

Now the first 6 figures chocolate series piggy are producing, finalizing, and going to launch. So we would like to make one more crowdfunding and preorder on  INDIEGOGO before its launch. 

We now provide up to 72% discount for preorder, on the other hand, we need your help to unlock the other 6 figures of the chocolate series. And there is an Exclusive Limited Edition SAKURA (100pcs) for INDIEGOGO backers!

這是《 甜蜜西遊》(JOURNEY TO THE SWEET) 的設計團隊。 現在，我們正在製作已成功眾籌的ART TOY - KIMOCHU 奇摩豬朱古力系列潮玩手辦！

首輪6只的可愛的朱古力系列小豬已經成功眾籌，並快將製作完成推出。 因此，我們想在 INDIEGOGO 推出之前再進行一次眾籌和預訂。

我們為預訂的支持者提供最高72%折扣優惠，同時也需要你幫助把朱古力系列餘下的6只造型眾籌解鎖；為答謝支持，推出了INDIEGOGO獨家限量版SAKURA（100件）！

 

 

Concept of KIMOCHU the CHOCOPI

奇摩豬的設計概念

 

 

Kimochu.G.Chocopi is the famous character from “Journey to the Sweet (JTS)”, He is Master Candy’s second disciple, the monster of rose alcohol-filled chocolate. When he is excited, his nose will turn into a heart shape, and heart beams begin pouring out from his nose. He has a childhood sweetheart -- Sakuchu Sakurapi, which is a lovely pinky piggy.

The idea behind the name “Kimochu'' comes from certain etymology. In Japanese, uh, let's call them "action films''. You'll often hear it in the dialogue of these films. KimoCHU sounds very similar to “KimoCHI”, which in Japanese means "feeling good"（気持ちいい）. Moreover, the word "CHU" represents the sound of "KISS" in Japanese. ; In Chinese, “Chu'' means “chocolate”, it also sounds like "Pig". Anyways, for our purposes, we design the chocolate theme for our first Kimochu figure series. 

The guiding concept design behind KIMOCHU is that when we taste chocolate, we tend to have a very good feeling overcome us -- much like falling in love. So yes, to answer your question: Chocolate Kimochus make you feel like falling in LOVE!

讓我們來介紹一下《甜蜜西遊》的人氣角色——別名奇摩豬的朱八戒！奇摩豬是糖三藏的二弟子，是從天界掉下來的玫瑰酒心朱古力化成而成。當他情緒高漲的時候，奇摩豬的鼻子能變成心型發射出愛心光波！奇摩豬還有一個熱戀中的女友——櫻花豬朱小花。

那麼，為什麼他會叫KIMOCHU(奇摩豬)呢？在日文中，「気持ちいい(KIMOCHI）」有著輕鬆、舒服的意思，同時「CHU」在日本是接吻時的發出的形聲詞； 在漢語中，豬八戒的「豬」又和朱古力的「朱」同音。所有文字元素加在一起就變成奇摩豬 KIMOCHU啦！

正因為奇摩豬的名字中有KISS的意思，加上他那心型的鼻子，奇摩豬的一切都會讓你聯想愛，所以奇摩豬同時也是代表著「愛」的角色！

 

What is in Your Perk?

你的禮物裡有什麼？

 

We aimed to produce high-quality design products. In this project, we are going to produce 12cm figures of Kimochu, one of the characters from JTS. There are 6+1(+6) different designs in total and they will be launched as a blind box. In other words, you will know which Kimochu you have got only after you open your box! Each box will come with a birth certificate so it will be a series of art toys that are worth collecting. 

生產高品質的設計是我們最重要目標。 在這個項目中，我們將製作12cm的Kimochu奇摩豬潮流手辦。 總共將有6 + 1（+6）個不同的設計，它們將作為盲盒啟動。 換句話說，只有打開包裝盒，您才能知道擁有哪個Kimochu手辦！ 而每個盒子都會附有出生證明，因此它是一系列值得收集的收藏品。

Each certificate have it unique birth number
每盒模型裡都有一張獨一出生編號的證書

The figures average height is 12cm
每盒模型裡都有一只平均12CM的奇摩豬 朱古力系列 潮流玩具手辦

KIMOCHU X INDIEGOGO
Exclusive LTD Edition

 

Kindor Sakura INDIEGOGO Exclusive Edition only can get it in this limited period.

Kindor Sakura INDIEGOGO 獨家版都只能在這段期間有限預訂

MORE AMOUNT FUNDED, MORE FIGURES WILL BE UNLOCKED & SELECTABLE!

眾籌總數愈多，被解鎖及可選擇的造型更多！

 

Perk Choices

禮物選擇

There are many choices of Perk and up to 72% discount for the INDIEGOGO preorder.

這裡有很多不同預訂選項，這次預訂最高可獲贈高達72%的優惠。

 

Others and Add-on

其他選項 及 附加禮物

 


GAIN FREE KIMOCHU?

想免費獲得一隻KIMOCHU 嗎?

 

Invite everyone to back our project and receive a free KIMOCHU blind box series figure to your order for every successful referral. No limit on how much you can earn!

The referee will also get extra KimoChu Sticker Set. Let’s reap the benefits together!

只要你們介紹一位朋友，你就會獲得多一隻KIMOCHU公仔。
介紹朋友愈多，而獲得的KIMOCHU就會愈多。

你只要完成一次訂單，我們就會分享一條獨有的連結給你。
最後只要有朋友用這連結進入頁面，而且達成訂單，你自動會獲得KIMOCHU 一隻。

 

Challenge Rewards

完成挑戰並解鎖伸展目標

 

Complete challenges & unlock stretch goals!! Now that we're met our funding goal, let's raise a more reward. Complete the challenges & post on social media to unlock stretch goals. 

完成挑戰並在社交媒體上發布，讓我們解鎖目標來獲得更多獎勵！

 

 

Attach a link to

the prize contest

INSTAGRAM post

 https://www.instagram.com/p/CMJAiuYgiSo/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link

 

附上競獎活動

INSTAGRAM

帖子連結

 https://www.instagram.com/p/CMJAiuYgiSo/?utm_source=ig_web_copy_link

story:
Drips Cafe & Art Bar

Hi! My name is Jess and I have an idea. Big news there, this is a crowdfunding site, everyone's got an idea. Mine is a little more locally focused. I am from the Binghamton, NY area, and while we have a thriving art scene of galleries, we seem to be lacking in studio space. I have always wished I was still able to access all of the supplies and tools I was able to use in school, so I thought "Why not make a place like that for everyone?" Thus enters Drips! 

This campaign is to raise the funds necessary to open Drips Cafe & Art Bar at it's bare minimum start up cost. This money would go toward a physical location to set up shop and some basic equipment to get us started. Our mission is to change lives through art and hopefully create a lasting home base for artists and creatives across the Southern Tier. Through your help and our vision, I know we can make and maintain an atmosphere of creative excellence.

Contributing to this campaign would not only help me achieve a personal dream of mine, but also open up access to many brilliant creative minds who would otherwise have nowhere to express their creativity.

What We Need & What You Get

The following is a break down of where we plan to use every cent of the money we hope to raise here. Being open with our backers is important to us. We want you to feel confident that your donations will be going to a worthy cause.

We are hoping to raise $15,000. While this may seem substantial, this is just the tip of the iceberg. In order to get our base of operations up and running, we will first need a location! I've found a very promising location for a grand total of $20,000 a year. This would be an ideal price point for us to start with, and a large portion of funds raised would go to a down payment for the space. We would have a small coffee bar, a supply shop, and plenty of space for tables, chairs, easels, etc. The coffee bar would be the second focus of the funds from this campaign. For professional cafe equipment, we will need a minimum of $6500. This will pay for An industrial coffee brewer ($1000), a point of sale system ($1500), a refrigerator/ freezer unit ($1000), a water filtration system ($1000), an espresso machine ($1000), and an industrial coffee grinder ($1000). These prices are estimates based on my research. If we can find these items for less money, any overage will go straight to stocking up on beans, cups, pumps, storage, and other necessities. I believe in full transparency, so I intend to keep an up to date log of all funds going out and coming in for interested backers.

If we don't make it to our goal, any funds we receive will be donated to arts education at a local high school. If we do make it to our goal I hope to host many community fundraising events to support the arts in our schools.

The Impact

I have put my whole heart into this project. I spent over a year honing and thinking and brainstorming. I asked questions, I took criticism, I listened to what you had to say. I think I can say with confidence that this is something our area would greatly benefit from not only in the short term but also in the long run as well. I know there are other spots around town that offer creative space and art classes, but there's nothing really available to the lower income community who can't afford to invest in multiple classes or a large amount of supplies. I was one such individual. My dream is to open a studio where people from all walks of life can access their creative minds. I want someone to come in, pay $5, $10, $20 and have the creative outlet of their dreams. My goal is to have equipment available for rent (printing presses, easels, throwing wheels, etc. These items are currently hard to access for the general public. We want to help those who are doing such a wonderful job beautifying Binghamton.

Risks & Challenges

There is always the risk when opening any small business that it will fail. I have put a lot of time into researching ways to combat that risk. I am self taught in social media marketing strategies from my previous work, I am learning new and exciting business strategies every day, and I have a network of creative friends willing to help get this project off the ground. With community support and financial backers, I believe with my research, drive, and passion will make this venture a success. But you can't get anywhere without taking that first step and I would be honored if you would take that step with me.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are accepting any donations of unwanted art supplies, crafting materials, tables and chairs to keep our start up costs low. I am also putting together some fundraising ideas that require the help of local artists, so if you are interested in contributing your own artwork to the cause, please reach out to us at Drips.art.bar@gmail.com

And of course like, share, and talk us up! We can't wait to get started with you!

Drips Cafe & Art Bar
Hi! My name is Jess and I have an idea. Big news there, this is a crowdfunding site, everyone's got an idea. Mine is a little more locally focused. I am from the Binghamton, NY area, and while we have a thriving art scene of galleries, we seem to be lacking in studio space. I have always wished I was still able to access all of the supplies and tools I was able to use in school, so I thought "Why not make a place like that for everyone?" Thus enters Drips! 
This campaign is to raise the funds necessary to open Drips Cafe & Art Bar at it's bare minimum start up cost. I am also putting together some fundraising ideas that require the help of local artists, so if you are interested in contributing your own artwork to the cause, please reach out to us at Drips.art.bar@gmail.com
And of course like, share, and talk us up! We can't wait to get started with you!

story:
MEZZO: An Experimental Fashion Event

Every year the Multi-Media Event Class at the Maryland Institute College of Art (MICA) produces, directs, and creates an experimental fashion show that is showcased in the Spring. In order for this to happen, we need your help! This year we present to you, our show, MEZZO. 

This year’s twelve designers are creating a range of performances from puppetry, to sculpture, to fashion. We have created our brand, and are busy putting together our collections.
We’ve booked our venue at the historic Baltimore War Memorial in Downtown Baltimore, Maryland. On April 21, 2018 our collections, passions, and visions will be brought to life on stage. 

This production is much more than just twelve designers. . . We are working alongside photographers, videographers, graphic designers, sound artists and technicians to create the best event possible. We need your support to help all artists come together and collaborate for MEZZO. We thank you in advance and we hope to see you there!

Your contributions will help support our technicians,  artists and collaborators. Contributions go towards posters, merchandise, seating, and making your experience at the Baltimore War Memorial even more enjoyable! Your generosity will not only help this show, but will also go towards future productions by the Multi-Media Event Class. 

Designers: Courtney Banh, Claire Cho, Alexandra Ciardullo, Marina Constantine, Amanda Elie, Margaret Garrison, Grayson Gross, Clarissa Iskandar, Breanna Marinaccio, Stevie Pnewski, Charlie Rincon-Rodriguez, and Emily Wolfe.

story:
Have you ever had the desire or the urge to try something new? Are you looking to get away from the fast-paced world of today and make the most of ‘me’ time? Do you think you have an untapped creative side waiting to come out?

 

My name is Sharlene and I believe that it is never too late to learn a new skill and enjoy a new experience. Over the last 2 years, I have taken my passion for watercolors to the next level by producing commissioned work and conducting workshops. Now, I want to bring my workshop into the comfort of your own home where you can learn at your leisure. I will give you all the instructions you need through my online class, and if you choose to, I’ll provide the same high-quality supplies which help me create my art.

For me, watercoloring has become an escape from the outside world and I believe that by undertaking my course, you too can enjoy your own escape and embrace your creative side.

I look forward to welcoming you to my world as we both explore the magic of watercolors together.

​

 

The course will offer something for everyone, regardless of your artistic experience. Split into three 2 hour videos (6 hours in total), my online workshops cover everything from basic painting skills to complex watercolour techniques. In addition to this, I will focus on teaching you the RIGHT procedures and style so you will be equipped to apply your newly found skills to new challenges, and explore your own watercolour pathway. You will see immediate return on your efforts, as you apply your hands on learning experience as you create your own piece in the beginners class. As you progress through each workshop, we will continue to build on your skills and techniques. The easy to follow, intuitive workshops will be structured into:

 

 

Part 1 - Beginner (Paint a simple dessert)

An introduction to the basics of watercoloring. Starting with basic sketching and watercolor techniques to water consistency such as toning and shading. I will also show you how to identify colors and match them along with how to add detail using brush strokes.

Part 2 - Intermediate  (Paint a main course)

The intermediate level will help you with refining your painting skills whilst tackling some more complex techniques. With this session, you will build on the basics you learned in Part  1 and apply them to a more difficult piece of art. 

Part 3 - Advanced (Create a food menu + Calligraphy)

With the advanced level, you will learn the more difficult and more technical skills of watercoloring. I will show you how to put the ‘wow’ factor into your paintings. Once completed, you'll have all the techniques and skills required to paint a complex design and create your own piece of art. 

 

 

  1. Basic sketching (simple shapes to form 3D Models)

  2. Watercolor techniques (WET-DRY Techniques, Gradated, Variegated, Flat wash, Reduce Pigment, Erase, Edging by scrubbing)

  3. Water consistency - Toning and Shading

  4. Apply color theory to paintings

  5. Mix colors from various pigments

  6. Advanced brush strokes technique for details - e.g stain effect for crumbs, flat wash for smooth surfaces 

  7. Making it (food) POP! realism (3D) with shadow and light

  8. Personalising your work with Calligraphy - e.g postcards, bookmarks, greeting cards, recipe book, journaling

 

 

One of the biggest challenges a student would face as a beginner would be choosing the right supplies from the hundreds of options out there. I’ve taken this unnecessary stress out of the process by providing them for you! My experience over the years has allowed me to test out many different types of brushes, paint, pens and paper, and from this I have gathered the best supplies out there suited for any beginner and included it in the kit so you don’t have to worry about it!

  1. Set of watercolors
  2. Color Palette
  3. 3x Brushes
  4. Watercolor Papers
  5. Secret gift

**Worth RM80 ($20 USD)

 

 

1.     Discover a new skill

It truly is my opinion that it is never too late to discover a new skill. In this day and age, there is a lack of people undertaking the skills that invoke emotion and pleasure. This is your chance to do so!

2.     Take a step back and slow down

The art of watercolor forces you to take a step back from the world and it provides the perfect platform to escape. There’s no better feeling in the world than getting lost in a painting.

 

3.     Embrace your creative side

I honestly believe that there is a creative side in any person and it just needs nurturing to bring it to life. There’s something wonderful about finishing a piece of art, looking at it and appreciating the uniqueness of what you have created.

 

4.     Achieve something that moves you

There’s a great sense of achievement when it comes to watercolours. Whether it's understanding the basics of sketching or perfecting the subtle brush strokes as you texturise and manipulate the paint.

 

Background

For as long as I can remember art has been my escape, and my passion. Throughout the last two years I have been transforming my passion into creations which I can share with the world. I first began selling my paintings for commission to local customers and universities. After gaining attention through social media channels, I was able to begin selling my art work overseas. Throughout the time of selling my paintings, my desire to share my passion of painting with others has continued to grow. I began running watercolor workshops, and found the reward of sharing watercolor painting with others has been especially fulfilling. It has given me an insight into running my workshops as my fulltime job. This is where I need your help. Expanding my workshop online is a crucial step in achieving my dream of running a full time workshop.

Start your watercolor journey today!

story:
ABOUT THE CAMPAIGN

 

The purpose of this campaign is to fund an official JWYOYO pre-order large run of The Chameleon Yo-yo, a collaboration with Turning Point Yo-yos, designed ny JWYOYO for long-string play. The ultimate purpose is to make LOTS of people happy in one given moment by performing this long-string yo-yo: 6-10 feet of string as opposed to the usual 3-5 ft, the bigger the better in terms of visibility from the audience's standpoint.

 

By supporting this campaign, you will not only receive an entertaining yo-yo product or experience, but will also be a co-producer in spreading the joy of yo-yoing throughout the world, in order to enlighten bored faces, escort people down memory lane via nostalgia, and open up the world to pure imagination.

 

 

THE PRODUCTION

 

I'm looking to do a batch of at least 40 Chameleons. I plan to produce at least 10 in each color. 

 

SPECS

 

Chameleon

Weight: 113 g

Diameter: 80.31 mm

Width: 50.66 mm

Trapeze Width: 45 mm

 

Chameleon Light

Weight: 102 g

Diameter: 80.31 mm

Width: 50.66 mm

Trapeze Width: 45 mm

 

I need $3,420 to produce 40 Chameleon Yo-yos

 

$3,420 will also cover the campaign's production & perks, material costs, and to give a little bit of support to the creative team that so graciously volunteered to help out!

 

The yo-yo is already designed as you may well know – it just needs the funds to do the biggest batch yet. Kentaro Kimura of Turning Point took on this collaboration and graciously designed the CAD file and manufactured the yo-yo! Also, Paul Yath from Crucial manufactured the first prototype to get the project started - my gratitude goes out to him as well!

 

The remaining amount will enable me to continue to produce high-quality yo-yo performances (and who knows, perhaps more performance-based yo-yos as well!) that can make thousands (and perhaps millions!) of people smile. And we all know that a genuine smile is good for the soul, and that which is good for the soul is good for the body and for the mind, for our overall health and well-being (not to get all philosophical on you or anything). Not only that –smiles are positively contagious!

 

I need $550 to produce each of the 4 colors.

 

The plan is to produce 10 Chameleon per the four colors.

 

If I don't reach my goal, the funds will still go towards manufacturing as many yo-yos and/or art pieces you've pre-ordered, and you will still get what you paid for. However, I need to get 10 Chameleon orders per color in order to make the large run possible! If I don't get 10 orders per color, I may have to ask you to switch to another color, so please share this with your friends so that we can get all of the colors for your enjoyment!

 

 

CHAMELEONS CHANGE COLOR NOT JUST TO DISGUISE THEMSELVES, BUT TO EXPRESS THEIR EMOTIONS.

 

SOLID COLOR OPTIONS

ACTUAL COLORS MAY DIFFER FROM THE FOLLOWING MOCK-UPS.

Free Shipping Around-the-World!

 

HAND-PAINTED DESIGN OPTIONS

$15 Shipping Around-the-World

 

(OR YOU CAN CHOOSE A "SURPRISE ME!" OPTION ON THE PRODUCT PAGE IF YOU WANT JWYOYO TO PAINT A MYSTERY CUSTOM DESIGN!)

 

Regular or Hand-painted Chameleon Yo-yos available for pre-order (when you contribute to this campaign)! Original, one-of-a-kind,  "please use" art pieces (yo-yos) by JWYOYO.

 

Making YO-YO PERFORMANCE a career!

 

As you practice long-string, you can become a professional yo-yo performer! You can use yo-yoing to earn wages for your service towards a particular community, event, or corporation. I'm here to lead yo-yoers (yes, that's the official term) in performing for career purposes. With the Chameleon Yo-yo, you can entertain for thousands, perhaps millions of people in one spectacular moment!

 

  • The Chameleon yo-yo can enable yo-yoers to make a living via performances.
  • So far, I've performed long-string yo-yo at Coney Island USA, Circus Muse, Aerial Experience Productions, and who knows, perhaps someday I will perform with Cirque Du Soleil or some other contemporary circus troupe!
  • I will continue to popularize & develop the long-string style of play by creating new tricks, but I'm also ever-so interested to see what YOU come up with! I'd be happy to talk with you about how you can turn your hobby into a money-making business / performing art!
  • Even if you're not a yo-yoer or don't intend to perform yo-yo for a living, there are other fun perks to keep you entertained and smiling from the heart. Support the campaign if you feel that the world could use more excitement, positivity, happiness, and yo-yo spectacle!

 

 

Entrepreneurial Endeavors

 

As a professional yo-yo performer. . . well, it's a career that hasn't really been done before with very few exceptions! To actually provide for a future family while making thousands and millions of people happy is no easy task! Everyday I battle thoughts of doubt about my endeavors – am I just crazy to think that I can pull this off? Well, maybe – but I'd much rather live a life of risk and excitement, even if it means I fail in the end, because I will have known that I tried my BEST and that I didn't just lounge around lazily (which sometimes I'm culprit of, TBH). Let's heed the call of destiny on our lives and continue our journey to becoming the best yo-yo masters we could possibly be!

 

  • The yo-yo chose me, I didn't choose the yo-yo (Harry Potter wand reference). Some things are destiny, and I encourage you to also pursue that skill, that goal, that dream that you've always felt weighing on your heart, that we tend to just sweep under the rug for a later time.
  • Being an entrepreneur requires focus, sacrifice, and expression! It also needs community support. An entrepreneur needs to work out, especially as a live performer, to maintain good health and focus – after all the mind & body & spirit are connected, in my opinion. It requires SO MUCH hard work, and many menial tasks. You wear multiple hats: you are your own assistant, intern, delivery man, janitor, etc. Keeping the goal & passion in mind, having discipline in work while taking necessary breaks, getting out to socialize and be part of one's community is essential as well!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Provide feedback so that I can know what you think and how I can make this product / yo-yo performance style even better! I am all ears. Please be specific and objective!
  • Please share this campaign with your friends and community on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or by word of mouth! A one-man band can't do it all. I need your help! And sometimes that just comes down to communication and getting people hyped about the project. :-)

Making YO-YO PERFORMANCE a career!
 
As you practice long-string, you can become a professional yo-yo performer! You can use yo-yoing to earn wages for your service towards a particular community, event, or corporation. I'm here to lead yo-yoers (yes, that's the official term) in performing for career purposes. With the Chameleon Yo-yo, you can entertain for thousands, perhaps millions of people in one spectacular moment!
 


The Chameleon yo-yo can enable yo-yoers to make a living via performances.
So far, I've performed long-string yo-yo at Coney Island USA, Circus Muse, Aerial Experience Productions, and who knows, perhaps someday I will perform with Cirque Du Soleil or some other contemporary circus troupe!
I will continue to popularize & develop the long-string style of play by creating new tricks, but I'm also ever-so interested to see what YOU come up with! I'd be happy to talk with you about how you can turn your hobby into a money-making business / performing art!
Even if you're not a yo-yoer or don't intend to perform yo-yo for a living, there are other fun perks to keep you entertained and smiling from the heart. Support the campaign if you feel that the world could use more excitement, positivity, happiness, and yo-yo spectacle!

 


 
Entrepreneurial Endeavors
 
As a professional yo-yo performer. . . well, it's a career that hasn't really been done before with very few exceptions! To actually provide for a future family while making thousands and millions of people happy is no easy task! Everyday I battle thoughts of doubt about my endeavors – am I just crazy to think that I can pull this off? Well, maybe – but I'd much rather live a life of risk and excitement, even if it means I fail in the end, because I will have known that I tried my BEST and that I didn't just lounge around lazily (which sometimes I'm culprit of, TBH). Let's heed the call of destiny on our lives and continue our journey to becoming the best yo-yo masters we could possibly be!
 

The yo-yo chose me, I didn't choose the yo-yo (Harry Potter wand reference). Some things are destiny, and I encourage you to also pursue that skill, that goal, that dream that you've always felt weighing on your heart, that we tend to just sweep under the rug for a later time.
Being an entrepreneur requires focus, sacrifice, and expression! It also needs community support. An entrepreneur needs to work out, especially as a live performer, to maintain good health and focus – after all the mind & body & spirit are connected, in my opinion. It requires SO MUCH hard work, and many menial tasks. You wear multiple hats: you are your own assistant, intern, delivery man, janitor, etc. Keeping the goal & passion in mind, having discipline in work while taking necessary breaks, getting out to socialize and be part of one's community is essential as well!
